Reviews.Title: “My top choice in LA”
Reviews.Author: lotsotripsneedsleep
Reviews.Content: I stay here if I can when I travel to Los Angeles. It is in a great location for most of Los Angeles with easy access on and off the freeways. There are great restaurants nearby and always something going on at LA Live. The rooms are quiet, well furnished, and comfortable. I have also attended meetings here and the meeting space is easily connected to the hotel rooms. One minor issue is the lack of a regular gift shop (the one they have is more like a boutique) so there is not place to pick up something you forgot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great location.”
Reviews.Author: damookie
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. The Staple Center along with numerous restaurants and bars are located right next to the hotel. While I was there, they had a great jazz trio playing in the bar. The best thing about this hotel is the personnel. All employees were very helpful and friendly. Off special note is the young girl who registered me into the hotel and the concierge. Unfortunately, I can't remember their names but they were so helpful. The best part was that, after our initial meeting, they would also greet me when they happen to see me in the lobby! A return visit to this hotel is definitely in my future.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive with terrible food!”
Reviews.Author: mccainmom
Reviews.Content: This hotel as expected was very expensive. Other than the LA Convention Center not much around it to walk to of interest. Not many restaurants that are walkable in the area so you are locked into using their restaurant, unfortunately. Lobby sofas and chairs are showing wear, especially the front area, with the very squished Ikat print pillows, that look like someone spent the night on them. Staff are very professional and courteous. Rooms are spacious but rather cold and too slick for my taste. Could never get the room cool enough to sleep under the comforter, it was always too hot to sleep with anything other than the top sheet. No bath tub. Shower control for a rain shower was placed where no matter what you do you get hit with cold water to turn it on. Charge for internet in the guest rooms but in the public areas you could log on free only 1 time per day. However, the worse thing was the food in the only restarant, LA Market. Cold atmosphere, all glass and cables. Service is good. Breakfast buffet is expensive but does have made to order omelets. DO NOT ORDER THE "FRENCH TOAST" It is basically 1/2 piece of a slice of bread. It was dry, it did not seem to have been dipped in a milk and egg mixture which would actually make it french toast, it just seemed to be bread toasted on a griddle. The Chop Chop Salad sounds delicious on the menu but the salad was cut up so small and mixed together with a strong over powering mustard vinegrette that you could not taste what little bacon or egg was actually in the salad (trust me, it was very little, just enough to be able to say these were ingredients). And run for your life away form the Messe Plate. I have to say it was actually terrible. I have never had tabuleh with no tomatoes, parsley, or onions in it. unitl I had it here. Just a bunch of bulgar wheat with no lemon juice, just tasted like water. Shame on this chef!!! The only good thing on the menu was their very expensive LA Market Hamburger which was actually surprisingly good. Had it 2 nights in a row as nothing else was truly edible.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, but nice”
Reviews.Author: MC_Bos
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference. The room is nice and has a contemporary, funky feel. The water pressure was kind of pitiful (I was on the 9th) floor, but I think that was more about being "green" than anything else. Staff were all very helpful and professional, and the location is now very useful as there are a number of interesting restaurants around the area, as well as a Starbucks right next door. I particularly recommend the Pantry Cafe for breakfast, and Rivera or Rosa Mexicano for dinner. That said - it's a fairly expensive property and the wireless/internet surcharge of $12.95 is ridiculously high given how poor/slow the connection often is. It's also an expensive cab ride from/to the airport If you're conducting business in the vicinity, I think this is a good place to stay. If you're vacationing LA, you might want to look at all your options.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: AXO1010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and also hosted a cocktail reception while there. The hotel is gorgeous, and the rooms are very spacious / clean and well appointed. I will stay at this hotel when my travels return me to L.A. Kerry's restaurant in the lobby, L.A. Market, is also fantastic. Please do try it when you're there!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Nice Vacation”
Reviews.Author: SduNyc
Reviews.Content: I had several trips for the past few months, almost forgot to write a review for this beautiful hotel. The hotel is only 20 minutes away from the airport (LAX) and in the heart of the downtown area. The lobby is beautiful and big which it doesn't look like a hotel lobby. The staffs were friendly. The room is beautiful and with a nice view at night. The only thing I don't like was they didn't replace shampoo and body wash until I called the house keeping for replacement. Also, my daughter was having a fever at night and I asked if they have any children fever reducing medicine, they had nothing for children. So, I had to go out and looked for a pharmacy at night. I would expect the hotel should have these kinds of things for a five starts hotel. Overall, this is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Broke the Mold When They Built This One!”
Reviews.Author: Nikolean
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this hotel. One the location is perfection! Two the views are amazing! Three you stay at the JW but receive the same quality of service as if you stayed at the Ritz which is connected. The concierge and front desk teams are BEYOND helpful. This hotel just opened about a year ago and it is beautiful. The young lady at the gift shop was very helpful as well making her recommendations not only for what I should buy but places I should visit. I can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: Stephlino
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights before heading literally next door to the Ritz (they share a building). The rooms were really beautiful, very nicely done. It's a newer hotel so they were in really nice condition. We had a corner room and the views were amazing! At the front desk everyone was friendly and welcoming. We ordered room service once for the dinner and it was really great food. They made our transition from there to the ritz very smooth without any issues or problems. We were on a high floor so we didn't have any issue with noise. The hotel is located right next to L.A. Live so it was wonderful to be able to walk to everything. We were able to walk to restaurants, stores and the grammy museum and there is even a movie theater a block away. It was also really close to the highway and we were able to jump on and off quickly. They did have a restaurant/lounge in the lobby (which was huge) and also an illy coffee shop which came in handy when we needed a caffeine fix. I would def recommend this hotel especially for first time visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in the Middle of Everything”
Reviews.Author: Where2Gowhere2go
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel. Parking is 40.00 a day - a bit pricey if you have your own car or a rental. Lots of action in the area. A nice venue and a good place for large events.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: friendlyinsomniac
Reviews.Content: Very nice new hotel near convention center. I stayed 5 nights in mid-April. The rooms are large and relatively quiet with views. Even from my room only on the 10th floor I could see all the way to the Hollywood sign. A few very small annoyances: the window would make a loud pop periodically during the day and at night. Also housekeeping does not seem to make it around until 3 or 4pm, a little bit awkward since I was attending a convention and would often come back to the room late in the day for a change of clothes after sessions before the evening events. Lesson learned - when I would leave in the morning I requested make up service and it was done right away. Excellent climate control, by the way, that can sometimes be an issue in these big hotels. There is free wifi in the lobby areas, but it is a $12.95/day charge in the room. Parking is $40/night in the garage, there is a surface parking lot that is only $8/day across the street - closer to the freeway. The place handles the crowds well, there were events at Staples Center several nights during my stay and though things get a little busy outside at LALive, the hotel always had things organized. Excellent food at LAMarket. There is a Starbucks just outside in LA Live as well as a dozen or so other restaurants (I recommend Rosa Mexicano!)

Reviews.Title: “convenient to convention center, keycard obnoxious”
Reviews.Author: USACityPlanner
Reviews.Content: this is a new upscale hotel located very close to the convention center. the room is quite nice with superior bedding. there is a convenient mini refrigerator iavailable n the room for guest use which was not stocked with overpriced goods.\ the biggest beef i had was the obnoxious key card needed to access the elevator. It wasnt the easiest to use and really did not provide any security as other passengers would help press buttons without having each pasenger enter there own key card. I also was locked out of my room as the card was disabled on the day of my departure which required me to wait for security to arrive. another guest accross the hallway was also waiting for the same thing. I also missed my connection to the airport over this screw up. there are not many choices of hotels in downtown los angles. if you are looking for upscale close ot the convention center this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: athena-fl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott for four nights while my husband attended a conference. We liked the modern, comfortable public spaces. Service was friendly and accommodating. We had a king room on a low (5th) floor. I was concerned about potential street noise, but we never had a problem. The room was very clean and like new. There was plenty of storage space so we were able to unpack and keep the room tidy during our stay. The room had a small fridge, in-room coffee, a safe, and nice workspace/desk and a small sofa/daybed. There's a charge for wireless internet in the room, which I find ridiculous. There were plenty of electrical outlets so we could charge our various devices with outlets left over and without putting them on the floor. The bathroom had only a shower--no tub--with a really, really lame water saving shower head. We thought it actually wasted water, as we took three times as long in the shower trying to rinse. The bathroom also had a magnification mirror, which I appreciated. There is a shortage of counter space and no shelf, so even if you pack light on toiletries you might find yourself hard pressed to find places to put your things. The gym was good, with plenty of treadmills, ellipticals, and two upright bikes. I noticed one recumbent bike. The equipment was in good condition and worked for the most part. One morning two of the treadmills were out of order in a continuous initializing mode. There were also weight machines, free weights, exercise balls, medicine balls, and a small open space. The only thing that slightly marred my stay was an incident early one morning. A gentleman got on the elevator with me and pushed the button for a different floor. He exited the elevator on my floor and seemed to be following me. I stepped aside to let him pass and was very surprised to see him stop at my room and proceed to bang on the door and shout for the occupants to open it. When there was no response, he asked the maid to let him in to the room because, he claimed, there was an emergency in there. What disturbs me is that the maid appeared ready to open the door for him until I stepped forward and said it was my room. Once I did that, the man said he was on the wrong floor, apologized, and rushed off. It seems that the maids should not randomly open rooms for people claiming to have emergencies. I would think SOP would dictate that security be summoned first. Despite that incident, we enjoyed our stay and found the JW Marriott comfortable. I stuck to public transit rather than fussing with a rental car and found that the hotel was well situated with a lot of transit connections close by.

Reviews.Title: “Met our expectations, great location for Lakers games”
Reviews.Author: pickering4
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night when we had tickets for the Lakers game in March 2012. Great location for LA Live and the price is reasonable for what you get. The hotel lobby was really busy because the Marathon was on and the weather was horrendous. We were really impressed by the valet attendants, as we were returning our Hertz rental at the hotel when we arrived. They took the car from us and brought it back to Hertz. Hertz followed up with a call to our room later in the day, to tell us everything was fine with the return. The check-in is fast and efficient. The rooms are spacious, clean and there is complimentary bottled water (which is always appreciated). The only downfall is the breakfast at The Market. Service is non-existent, it took forever, the food was ok and the bill was $70.00 for three. Eat out if it's not a hurricane outside!

Reviews.Title: “Nice downtown hotel convenient to all...”
Reviews.Author: Alma W
Reviews.Content: JW Marriott in downtown LA is about half a block from Staples Center. So, if you are there to watch a game (like we did) - this is the place to be. Around the area are several good & diverse eating places. Check-in was fairly quick. The hotel room is nice & spacious. There is coffee and comp water bottles waiting in your room Bathroom has a shower only - but it was relatively large. Rooms were generally quiet - but we were in the 17th floor. Conceirge was very helpful and there are a couple of terminals in the lobby just for airline check-in purposes.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: Jvmac
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel! Right in the center of everything you need to have a good time in LA! The rooms are very spacious and inviting. I will definitely go back and stay here! The staff was nice and very personable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, chic, contemporary, classy...”
Reviews.Author: DreamTraveler15
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay here and I have to say it was wonderful. Everyone I dealt with at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The valet parking was top notch and my vehicle was always ready to go by the time I made my phone call and got down to the parking garage. Mike at the concierge desk was very helpful and friendly and assisted me happily. I stayed in 1905 and had a wonderful view of the city skyline. The shower was AMAZING and the bed was extremely comfortable. There are some restaurants within walking distance and inside the hotel. I didn't eat at any, I traveled out of the downtown area for that. I would highly recommend the hotel, it did feel a bit too "LA" at times--but that is too be expected. The fitness center was great and I did not want for anything there. The facililty was great. I did not use the salt water pool, but was told it is fantastic. Overall, I would highly recommend the hotel. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice property, located in the heart of everything”
Reviews.Author: lmast26340
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business meeting and was pleasantly surprised at how many nearby restaurants and coveniencies there were, as in most of my previous experience LA is not very walkable. Hotel itself was very nice, attractive and spacious lobby, loved the illy expresso cafe, good-sized rooms, and a great fitness center. It was larger and had more machines than most hotel options. Plus, guests can also use the adjoining Ritz-Carlton spa for an extra indulgence.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty fancy!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer E
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business, and the hotel is impressive! Gorgeous lobby, comfortable rooms, excellent bar/lounge. The only complaints I had is the WIFI is spotty (mostly only available in the lobby) and it's so big and spread out. Great location if you want to stay around the LA Live and Downtown area, however its far from Beverly Hills, Hollywood, etc. A cab ride there will cost upwards of $60.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: bruce h
Reviews.Content: A big hotel with everything and convenient to the Staples and Convention center 100 yards away. Kind of expensive - as you can't get out of here for less than $300/day once you add in taxes. I never did see Kobe strutting through the lobby, but kind of a place to show off. This is not a spot for somebody wanting to save on their expense report! A beer for $10. Coffee was priced normally - I think because of the Starbucks next door! Issues with the hotel were a TV that I had to reboot and would take 15 seconds just to start up at near full volume and another 15 seconds to get off the main page. The pool was closed one day too. If you park across the street, you can cut your parking cost in half $22 versus $40 for the valet only Marriott lot. Also, the Ritz is connected, so you should compare the Ritz which shares the same building. They gotta be close on price. My discounted rate was 229, but with taxes, it was touching 300 per night. Maybe i'm cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and super spacious hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Kymmy_O
Reviews.Content: Definitely stay here if you need to be at the staples center or Nokia theater. Seriously, a two minute walk outside. The hotel is gorgeous inside. Very friendly staff that will help out at any time. My husband and I stayed here to see our favorite NHL team, the Oilers, play at the Honda center in Anaheim, and then at the Staples center the next night. We ended up seeing the whole team at the hotel since that's where most of the out of town teams stay. It was awesome!!! There are a tons of food/drinks selection just outside the hotel. We stayed in a King Executive room that had a big view of the Staples center. The rooms are very spacious and the bathrooms are very nice and HUGE. You could probable fit 4 people in your show(not sure if you would want to try that). Overall, we would definitely stay here again. The price of the hotel is great too.

Reviews.Title: “The JW Marriott of LA Live is distinctively chic.”
Reviews.Author: Cali-Tammy-P
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a weekend filled with variety and entertainment, then this hotel is the answer. Located in the heart of LA Live in downtown Los Angeles, this hotel puts you in the center of the happenings. Where else can you see a Lakers or Clippers game, see a concert, vist the Grammy Museum, have dinner and a movie, bowl a few games, and then dance the night away? JW Marrott is the answer. The rooms are very chic, and the rooftop pool parties are exhilarating.

Reviews.Title: “If only everybody in LA was as nice as the staff and property!”
Reviews.Author: Bridget101
Reviews.Content: We where there for a convention and the property definitely exceeded all of my expectations. Our room had a great view overlooking the pool and you could see Staples Arena and some of LA Live. There are many great restaurants right in the area including right inside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: LaurathePowers
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott is a first class hotel. It's only two years old, and the property is spotless. JW Marriott has modern decor, great convention space, and is conveniently located near the Staples Center, Nokia Theatre, and many restaurants. I stayed in a Junior Suite. The room was spacious and exceeded expectations. I was also impressed by the service. Check-in was efficient, and the staff was very courteous and helpful. I'd definitely stay at the hotel again and would recommend it to others who are traveling to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Big convention hotel that is very well run”
Reviews.Author: SteveH5863
Reviews.Content: This is a large, expensive convention hotel that actually exceeded expections. It is a beautiful property with a modern decor. Rooms, at least the one I had, was spacious and well-appointed. The bathroom was huge. The staff in general is courteous, outgoing, and well-trained. The hotel is spotlessly clean. And unlike some hotels designed for conventions, this property actually works. There is enough elevator capacity so that when the major group has a general session there are not long waits to get a car. The same can be said of the restaurant and bar. I only experienced the restaurant for breakfast but it was excellent. The lounge at the end of the day was extremely busy but the service was excellent. The hotel is part of the LA Live complex, which contains the Nokia Theater, LA Convention Center, Staples Center, the Grammy Museum, and many restaurants and bars. The hotel has ample banquet space of its own but is also an easy walk from the convention center. One thing, however. Bring money. The hotel and its services are not inexpensive and neither are the restaurants and bars in the LA Live complex. If you spend a lot of time in big cities and major hotels you are probably used to $24 breakfasts (for the excellent buffet+tax and gratuity) and $12-$20 drinks but this may be a shock to some. But in some cases you get what you pay for, and this hotel was excellent. One minor complaint, although I know this is common. If I am paying close to $300 per night for the room please don't charge me another $12.95 if I need to use the wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IRoseA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very new, so obviously it is clean and up to date with all new and latest. We stayed in a junior suite and it was very nice and spacious. I didn't like the fact that the bathroom was so large, but had very little counter space, apparently they didn't think about girls when designing this. The bed was comfy and our room had a nice view. The pool area is pretty, but we could never get the hot tub to heat up at all. We asked the staff, and they said next to let them know 30 minutes before hand and they would come warm it up for us, which was nice, but we didn't have time later in our trip. I hated the valet staff. The lady at the front desk told us they are not actually employed by the hotel, but they were rude! They were horrible and nasty and when they tried to "help" get our things out of the car, he just dropped the luggage everywhere and then blamed us! I understand they are not hired by the hotel, but they are the first contact you have with the hotel, maybe they should keep that in mind. Other than that, loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and modern... if not a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: bunny5C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is new, clean, and modern with spacious rooms and bathrooms and comfortable space. Service is top-notch and very attentive. The hotel is close to many restaurants and bars in LA Live, but there isn't much else in the immediate neighborhood. I had a few mior complaints - first, I was staying near the elevator banks and could hear the elevators at night. Second, I was staying in one of the rooms facing the Staples Center and there was a gigantic flashing video screen on at night, and the blackout curtains had some gaps at the top so light would stream in. Finally, the gym is very nice but quite small for the number of rooms in the hotel. I had to get there before 5 a.m. and still had to wait 10 minutes for cardio equipment, and the wait wasn't any better after 5 p.m. So, if you want to work-out, go at an off-hour. These are minor gripes and what prevented me from giving it 5 stars; overall, the hotel is lovely with lots of options for dining. Room service was also some of the best I've had at any hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is everything and more!”
Reviews.Author: jackman6020
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great staff, and great location! I had a wonderful night stay while attending the Human Rights Campaign dinner! Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at LA Live”
Reviews.Author: dogwalker2011
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a seven night stay at the JW Marriott. I stayed at this hotel whilst attending a conference. The hotel is close to the Nokia Theatre. It's the second time I have stayed here and the service was much improved on my last stay. Check in was swift and very helpful. My bags were delivered to my room without any fuss. Room service was good and fast - which is what you want when attending a conference. My room was clean and the bed comfortable. I found the Guest Service phone connection extremely helpful and if they couldn't answer your question immediately they would get back to you soon with an answer. I only ever ate lunch in the hotel restaurant and was not particularly inspired by the menu but again the service was good and fast. You have to pay on a daily basis for WiFi which is mildly irritating. The Spa is located at the adjoining hotel, the Ritz Carlton, and is excellent. I spent a relaxing morning there and had a wonderful massage. Although I spent long hours away from my room it was always nice and relaxing to go back. The check out procedure was again fast and for a very large hotel they just seem to have got things right. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for downtown LA.”
Reviews.Author: tolopez
Reviews.Content: We staid at this JW for 4 nights in March of 2012. It a newer property that is part of the LA live complex. Our check in was easy and the staff was very nice. Our room was on the 21st floor facing the city. The other people were with with were also on the 21st floor but facing the Nokia Theater. We had a king size room that was very spacious. One of the things we really appreciated was in addition to all the space there were plenty of places to unpack. The bathroom was also very large. The room had a modern feel as did the rest of the hotel. This hotel is great if you are going to LA live or the downtown area. It was also pretty easy to get to Universal and Warner Brothers studios. But getting to parts of Hollywood, Beverly Hills and Santa Monica was a mission. Especially with LA traffic. The hotel lobby is big, modern and great. They have an Illy espresso bar, a wine bar and a place for breakfast. If you prefer Starbucks there's one right next to the hotel in the LA live complex. I will say that the complex was very busy the entire time were there with an NCAA basketball tournament, a Lakers Game, a Clippers Game and the premier of the Hunger Games. It was exciting but there were a lot of people in and around the hotel lobby at all times. We did have dinner at WP 24 which is at the Ritz Carlton next door. You can actually get to the Ritz through the JW lobby which is nice when it's very busy outside. WP 24 is fantastic and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with the L.A. night life”
Reviews.Author: GlobalSShoper
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for this hotel, best thing is if you dont have any plans to go out you can relax in the hotel and still get the LA lifestyle. I stayed for one night and I was amazed at the lobby area. If I was not already going out I would have stay at the hotel and had a good time in their lounge. This is probably one of the few JW's out there that has a 20-35 year old atmosphere, who can blame them. I love the bathroom and the room itself the only down side was the tiny double beds in the room, did not really expect this for a JW but the rate was great. Had an issues with the air condition but by the time I got back to the room they set the temp to what i requested it too be ;-). keep up the good work. its 20 dollars to park your car over night, but for LA this is a deal especially Friday Night.

Reviews.Title: “L.A. Glamour”
Reviews.Author: lisarose
Reviews.Content: I get to stay here when the college basketball team I work with travels to L.A., and I look forward to it every time. I always get a spacious, beautiful room with an amazing view, and the property still has that "brand new" feel to it. Service is very helpful, and there are so many high-end lounges/bars to eat and drink at (if I had the money). Pool is medium-size with a bar and lots of tents/chairs/beds to lounge in. Rooms are quiet, sleep quality is excellent, overall just a luxurious place. Free wi-fi would have earned it another point.

Reviews.Title: “Great Access to Staples, Convention, and Nokia”
Reviews.Author: Sgoudeseun
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a fitness convention. Room was clean and in working order. Staff was VERY HELPFUL. Close to LA Live and activities held there including frequent filming of television programming. NCIS LA was filming during the two days I stayed and it gives you a look behind the camera, not to mention star gazing. I'd stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service in a brand new, giant hotel”
Reviews.Author: aoc1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week while working in LA. I was working on an event being held in the hotel itself, so I spent almost all of my time inside the hotel, only going out into the surrounding area for a couple of meals and some basics (water, snacks). The hotel is enormous, and attached to the convention centre. Brand new, and impeccably clean, the hotel staff was friendly and always ready to help. Room service and food service staff were a pleasure to chat with, and always professional. The business centre was also very helpful with friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are nicely furnished, contemporary-feeling, with large walk-in shower (no tub), with some nice toiletries. Housekeeping was great and respectful of my things. I ordered room service on several nights when I worked very late, the portions are quite large, always thoughtfully plated, made me feel taken care of after some very long days. You have climate control in each room, and a large armchair and couch, tv with lots of clothes storage space (wardrobe and large dressers). My favourite part of the furnishings was the desk/table on small wheels that you could drag to wherever you needed it in your room. When I'd finally get to my room at night, I could order room service, pull the desk to the side of the bed, and eat in bed comfortably, while watching some trashy tv before crashing. Small things like that make me very happy. Outside of the hotel, you walk right into LA Live -- where there is an array of restaurants. My favourite, I went twice during my 1 week stay, was Katsuya. Try their seafood sampler, or crispy tuna rice dish. AMAZING. Also conveniently nearby is a Ralph's (grocery and pharmacy and all-in-one store, where they also have cheap, hot food take-out, wine, dry-cleaning...everything). It's less than a 15 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: LauraPPP
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very very clean. Rooms are spacious huge beds lovely bathroom Shame we didn't have a car as a bit far away from things The lovely Joy at the concierge was really helpful and helped us make the most of our few days there Not much to do their outside of LA live but some nice restaurants arounds

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the J.W. Marriott at L.A. Live for a conference in February 2012. Hotel is clean, bright and lively. Rooms are spacious and modern. J.W. Marriott and Ritz Carlton are co-located on the same property and there is a lot of traffic due to the 2 hotels and the conference facilities they share. Lobby bars are lively well into the night. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Devil in the details”
Reviews.Author: erster
Reviews.Content: Lots to like about this hotel. It's new, modern, elegant. Gorgeous lobby and good restaurants. The rooms are gigantic. For anyone doing business or attending events at the convention or the Staples Center it's a great location, and an easy walk to other attractions. I was disappointed by housekeeping, though. The first morning, I left the room around mid-morning and made sure to put the Do Not Disturb sign back inside. I was at the convention center all day, returning around 5. And NO ONE had serviced the room! The bed was unmade, the coffee supplies not replenished, the trash baskets full. I called guest services right away and they apologized up and down and said they'd send someone up right away to get things put to rights. I had to leave again so went off confident that when I returned I'd have a nice clean room and empty waste baskets. Got back to the room again about 10 PM only to find that IT WAS STILL A MESS. Somebody dropped the ball, big time. I called guest services again and told them what I thought of their "service." They apologized up and down, asked if I wanted someone to come up now (as if! I wanted to hit the sack) and asked if they could give me a free breakfast among other things I didn't want. Finally I was offered a credit to my account that I accepted though still wasn't particularly mollified. For a higher priced hotel, this lapse showed incredible sloppiness and negligence. Other minor irritations included the gigantic illuminated sign right outside my window (on the south side of the building) that was on all night, and the curtains didn't close quite tightly enough to shut the light out completely. Also at 5 the next morning loud amplified music started to boom and continued until I just decided to get up since I couldn't sleep any longer. Never did figure out where it was coming from. Finally, whoever planned the room layout made a mistake in not locating the refrigerator in the cabinet just inside the door, instead of right under the TV in the bedroom proper. It was pretty noisy in both rooms (I asked to move after the loud booming music and got an identical room on the other side; alas, the fridge in that room was even louder; I had to unplug it). Though there are lots of nice things about the facility, and everyone I dealt with was nice, I doubt that I'd stay there next time. Too many glitches.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect if you are attending a function at the Staples Center”
Reviews.Author: sheilaski
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here when attending the Grammy's at the Staples Center. Perfect location, lots of bars and restaurants within one block, comfortable bed, very clean and modern decor, nice pool. No complaints, it is pricey though.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: sis1988
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing.. Brand new hotel and could not be in a better location. From the Valet to the Housekeeping staff, this property is top knotch. We had a room on the 16th floor that overlooked LA live and the rooftop pool/bar. Room was spacious and very comfortable. The bathroom was quite large and the beds were perfect for a great night sleep. The business center was a bit pricey but had everything you need. Close to USC and many great shops and restaraunts. Concierges was the best ever! Offering airport transportation would be a great perk for this property. Thank you for a fabulous time...

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ParisintheFall09
Reviews.Content: Good location if you need to be downtown LA. Service was excellent and rooms were spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “brand new hotel, very cool place”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkJack99
Reviews.Content: i was very surprised when we got here. the hotel is in a brand new building and very well designed. it is attached to the staples center and many restaurants. the rooms were very nicely done althou we found the bed hard for our taste. staff was very professional but its an 800 room property so alittle robotic - still very pleasant. only isue we had was due to connecting room door and a loud bunch of young girls next door we heard more than we cared to - giggling etc when we were sleeping .

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great venue!”
Reviews.Author: Moira L
Reviews.Content: I was recently at the IOC World Women and Sport Conference at LA Live. Everything was at our fingertips and it was easy to move around. The organizers worked extremely well with the hotel and the venue is very impressive facility; very clean and tidy and fresh looking with friendly staff. The location is second to none!!! I will definitely go back on a vacation instead of work :)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to be in the center of it all”
Reviews.Author: Todieinparis
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Grammy Awards which we were attending at the Staples Center and Convention Center both of which are right next door. This is a luxury hotel and you pay what you get for. This is the most I have ever paid for a room. We booked a junior suite for 3 nights - the price difference between a room and a junior suite was not great so we upgraded. The hotel booked up very quickly after the Grammy nominations were announced - we booked that very night - more than 2 months ahead of time. I did research for other attendees and the price at the JW was in line with other nearby hotels. The room itself was great - I joked that if you jumped out the window you would land on the Staples Center. We were that close. The view - facing the Staples Center was spectacular. The junior suite we had was a corner room on the 12th floor with windows on two sides. The layout didn't make the most use of space but it felt very spacious. Upon entering, you step into a space about the size of a small hotel room that has a couch in it and a bar. Then, a small hall leads to the main room with the bathroom on the right (large step in shower - a bathtub would have been nice but not a huge issue) and big sink area. We could have used a little more closet space but again not a major issue. The bed was super comfy and at the far end was a couch with two large chairs and a coffee table - we were able to comfortably entertain guests in our room (the only issue was getting them up since all floors are key carded - great for safety but not great for having people come up - you either leave a list at the front desk or come down and get them). We had two little issues - one was lousy internet signal which we paid $12.95 a day for (we received a refund when I requested it - the front desk said the hotel was full and that was the reason - we had to use the hot spot on my phone) and the only room service we ordered (breakfast on the day of the Grammys for 2 which cost $60 and was nothing super fancy) came 45 minutes late and we had to gulp it down. Also requested and got a refund for that. Overall, I would stay here again despite the little issues. The staff was very attentive and met all of our needs and was eager to help when we had issues - the request to refund met with no argument. There was a lot of noise coming from the Staples Center the morning of the Grammys - the ceremony included an outdoor concert so sound checks started at 8 am - if staying there during an event this might be an issue for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Brenda C
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times in the past few years while attending The People's Choice Awards, MusiCares and the American Music Awards at the Nokia Theater, and the Convention Center - both are very close. The Grammy museum is just around the corner, and there are lots of great restaurants within 2 blocks of the hotel. The hotel is attached to the Ritz Carlton which has a wonderful spa and well equipped and immaculate work out facility. The rooms are clean, comfortable and have nice large bathrooms. They have all the ammenities, safe, coffee pot, robes, ironing board/iron etc. Although it is in the middle of a very busy area in terms of night life we found it quiet. The restaurant in the hotel has a wonderful breakfast buffet and there is a coffee shop in the hotel and a Starbucks just out the back door. We will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Unobtrusively wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Skrice
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. Every time I had a need, it was met. The standard room was nice and big with just the right amount of furniture, big TV, comfortable bedding. Bathroom was quite big and the nice big shower magically didn't steam up the whole place, I really appreciated that. I liked that the lobby was busy, a place that people really used. I didn't find the lobby bar super-welcoming to me (a single, female, non-young/ non-fabulous person) but was certainly adequate in terms of service. The desk staff was extremely efficient and very welcoming. The meeting facilities and food at the meeting were nice and bit different from the usual (trail mix bar, for example).

Reviews.Title: “Yes, a hotel I actually like”
Reviews.Author: SYTrips
Reviews.Content: I am a very hard person to please when it comes to hotels. Read my other reviews. I had a room that overlooked LA Live. So here are my reasons for the 5 rating!! 1 - Excellent service. I live in LA, and trust me, to find nice people that are so accommodating, is hard. They have done an excellent job of finding a great staff. 1 - CLEAN - When you walk in, it's clean enough to walk on the carpet without your shoes on. I know, a rare thought in a hotel room. But it's kept clean to a very high standard, and you do have that comfort level. 1 - Ultra modern. Very modern furnishing, and all still appear to be in good condition and new. 1 - Bed - the bed is so comfortable. It's almost as nice as the heavenly bed that the Westin group uses. 1 - General overall satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal_SD
Reviews.Content: This hotel is centrally located and walking distance to multiple restaurants and entertainment locations. My room had a great view of the pool and the Staples Center. I also utilized the gym, which being a regular traveler I see plenty, was well laid out and supplied with everything one would need. The staff was great and handled my 950 coworkers taking over their hotel very well. The meals planned for us were great and always fresh. The hotel was also laid out in a manner that allowed us to take over the hotel without disrupting the other guests.

Reviews.Title: “LocationLocationLocation (is a bit loud)”
Reviews.Author: LAEWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a typical Marriott product with a great location in LA. Breakfast in LA Market was mediocre and somewhat expensive for what you received. The noise level when concerts are happening is the greatest drawback of this property - I was on a high floor and I could hear the music until 11 p.m., which is not good when it's a weeknight and you just want to sleep early. The front desk clerk I spoke to upon checkout expressed regret that I didn't call her and get the free earplugs. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “the center of downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: KMB33
Reviews.Content: the JW is the place to stay if you are doing anything at Staples Center or Nokia Theater. Lots of great restaurants within walking distance. Rooms are comfortable; staff is really pleasant and helpful. Now if they could just fix up the rest of downtown LA... Would have given them an excellent but internet access was 12.95 a day and very sketchy.

Reviews.Title: “Great expensive hotel!”
Reviews.Author: m2347m
Reviews.Content: My hubby surprised me for my birthday weekend. Rented the corner suite on the 21st floor. The view is awesome. The room is huge. The furniture is ehh, just okay and I felt there just wasnt enough furniture to fill the room. There's a sofa by the windows and a mod chair. A desk. Two chairs by the window facing the freeway, a closet and the bed. It definitely was not a plush room. Maybe it's all about the view. I dont know. The bed was very comfortable. We had dinner at WP24. The food can be compared to PF Changs but double the price. Breakfast was included in our room rate so we also had breakfast at the LA market on the first floor. I had french toast. It was very bland. My hubby had blueberry pancakes. Also very bland. We had stayed the night to see the Michael Jackson Immortal show. The show was awesome. I would stay at the hotel again for the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice. What you would expect.”
Reviews.Author: Kashay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is what you would expect of a newer Marriott property. The rooms are a decent size. The style was updated and had a little edge. The internet was $12/day. Seriously, who still charges? We were there for a conference and they expertly handled the large amount of traffic. It is right in the center of LA Live and it's restaurants. Room service came quicker than they quoted me. Nothing too exceptional but nothing to complain about. I'd return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Views, Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: BigJuanJohn
Reviews.Content: I booked a Jr. Suite here since we were going to see a concert. I asked for a high floor. I was very pleased to get the highest floor they have (21st floor). Because the junior suites are in the corners, you get two great views. We were in 2167 so we had great views of the staples center and 180 degrees from there, past LA Live area to the high buildings of downtown. On another window, we had the views of Hollywood hills and the Hollywood sign. The room is very large and has a retro modern look. It was one of the biggest showers i have seen with one of those big elephant wash shower heads. We actually left the blinds open for most of the night because the lights, and light reflections, looked warm and romantic. We did have to shut them early morning to get sleep. Overall I thought this was a great stay, plus we only had to walk to the concert and back. That was a big plus. My room rate covered the $40 valet and free breakfast at LA Market. That saved us $80 on this trip. I did peek into one of the non-junior suite rooms when the maid was in it, and they looked pretty nice too. The only con I would say is that the blinds just don't make the room dark enough if you like to sleep in. Other than that, it was a great place to stay in the LA Live area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Venue but....”
Reviews.Author: Alohacraig
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott & Ritz Carlton at LA Live is a great venue. The Public spaces have that big Wow factor you would expect in this type of venue. I was just there for a conference that had 2,400 attendees. The staff did a good job but they did get overwhelmed. The conference had the lobby under lock down and I can understand why but that was just wrong. As a paid attendee and a paying guest of the hotel the lobby and its amenities should be open. As for the rooms at the JW Marriott I was disappointed I had expected a better room considering the price. I have also stayed at the Ritz and there rooms are great.

Reviews.Title: “Walking in LA”
Reviews.Author: Pops44
Reviews.Content: The JW is a great hotel situated right in the mix of the convention center, Staples center and Nokia Center. The LA Live development has a lot of energy at night with great walkable restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for business trip to LA”
Reviews.Author: wllsu
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week with a large group for business last week. The staff was very accommodating and even made room for us during a very busy week in which the hotel was otherwise sold out. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful - arranging for transportation, etc. whenever we needed it. The valet staff was also great - helped us load and unload several large boxes in our vehicle everyday. The bar was very nice - the outside patio was especially pleasant - though I honestly didn't feel quite cool enough to be there. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great LA LIVE location, quality service, sleek rooms”
Reviews.Author: JV101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business and had a fantastic experience from check-in until check-out. Cannot say enough about this hotel-- great staff that bends over backwards to assist you, fantastic rooms, great lobby bar with nice vibe, good hotel gym, and excellent in-room dining. If you are headed to a Lakers/Clippers game or a concert at the Staples Center, this place is perfect. Only cons-- very expensive $$$$ parking; other than LA LIVE, not much else is around the hotel-- Downtown LA leaves a lot to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “People's Choice Award show & Marriott - great combo”
Reviews.Author: Cfsdir
Reviews.Content: My team ran the PCA show and I had meetings in LA live all week, hotel is perfect. For business and fun. The front desk staff worked hard to accommodate my needs for room changes. Room and view were incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Farzana770
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott Los Angeles L.A. LIVE is centrally located to numerous restaurants, nightlife, and entertainment venues.....yay! The property is new and well-appointed. Guest rooms are spacious and very comfortable. The staff and service was over the top. From arrival to departure the Hotel staff was gracious and very accommodating......even for my 4am departure!

Reviews.Title: “Right next to the Nokia Theatre”
Reviews.Author: MrSharma
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Right next to the Nokia Theatre - Very close to the Los Angeles Convention Centre (venue for many conferences) - Spacious, good, clean rooms Cons: - Expensive rooms - Expensive business centre - No bathtub

Reviews.Title: “Classy, Comfortable, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: SanFranciscoCharley
Reviews.Content: Great location! If you are looking to be in the heart of entertainment, shopping and food (at a big-box level) without needing to drive anywhere then this is the hotel for you. Room was impeccable, comfortable and clean. Hotel offers restaurant(s)/bar(s). Courteous and professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek, modern hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Waterm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our honeymoon and were not disappointed! Excellent service, great, spacious and clean rooms (with a lovely bathroom), very good concierge - cannot complain! As it was our honeymoon we also received complimentary desserts and champagne! Good location, close to numerous restaurants, staples centre (we could see it from our room window) and close to the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Mgbeaty
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an executive king room over Rose Bowl weekend. Despite appearing pretty full, the staff did an excellent job and the amenities were great. We will certainly be back when our team returns to the Rose Bowl next year!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: WItraveler91
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the JW Marriott at LA Live during our stay for the 2012 Rose Bowl. It was a fantastic hotel choice. There is a lot going on in the area, Staples Center, Nokia Theatre, Grammy Museum to name a few. There are also some very good restaurant choices that are a short walk from the hotel. The hotel itself has a fabulous lobby which is great for people watching and relaxing. It has above average food and a great staff to serve you. The lounge was very upscale and enjoyable. The rooms are bigger than most hotel rooms and were very clean. The views from the rooms were awesome as well. Overall, the hotel exceeded my expectations. I would definitely stay there again in fact, we didn't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: 09cas
Reviews.Content: This modern hotel has a beautiful exterior, lobby, restaurant and guest rooms. The hotels cleanliness and styling exceeded expectations. This hotel is in the perfect location to enjoy the Staples Center and L.A. Live!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: AustinBadger
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the Rose Bowl and loved it. First, it is in a fantastic location with the Staples Center literally about 600 feet away and several very good restaurants right nearby (Wolfgang Puck, Flemings, Starbucks, etc). You can be very entertained and well-fed without leaving the premises. Second, the service was very good. We arrived at 2 pm and our room was not ready for a 4 pm check-in. Once it was ready, they upgraded us at no charge to a junior suite, which was fabulous. I found this to be a very classy move. Further, the servers at the hotel restaurant were all super friendly. In fact, our desert was somewhat late to arrive and the waitress comped our cappuccino. It is little things like that that makes the place really great. I think downtown LA is a very good location to be because you are only about 10 minutes from Hollywood, Beverly Hills, etc. And with all the stuff around this hotel, you can't go wrong. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Reputation Holds it's Own”
Reviews.Author: 1Solshine
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at Marriott locations all over the world for the last 11 years. This one was not a disappointment! We layed over here for a day and a half on the way out of the country. It is not especially close to LAX but was worth it! It is close to restaurants and the area is bustling with activitiy. We also went to the musuem of natural history (is that the right name?) closeby and spent the day. I had two rooms adjoining each other. The rooms were up to date, clean and the bathrooms were quite modern. We didnt order room service. True to the Marriott brand, the beds were comfortable and clean. The price was great but then I was on government per diem so am not sure of the regular rates. I was not however very impressed with the choices at the restaurants (despite the cordial staff ) so we did eat out a few times. We did have an unfortunate event that happened. There is a plexi-glass divider between the one of the restaurants and outer seating area. It would have been nice if it was frosted or something as my son ran right into it as we were entering the restaurant not realizing it was plexi-glass. He ended up with a small bump on his head. It also would have been nice if there was an airport shuttle but ground transportation is plentyful so we made it work. I would definately stay here again when I have more time to really enjoy it and get out exploring!

Reviews.Title: “Rose Bowl and a bed of Roses”
Reviews.Author: OMI1234
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful location with a staff to match. We stayed here recently for the Rose Bowl and they exceeded our expectations at every turn. We enjoyed the pool, dinner at the restaurant, the workout room and being close to everything you will need for a great visit. We stayed on a high floor with a great view of the Hollywood Hill and the City. The room was perfect but you will not spend much time in it with the location and all that it has to offer. We were close enough to the Rose Bowl and Pasadena but also to the Staples Center, Restaurants and a great nights sleep. I stay at over a hundred hotels a year and I will tell you the service is truly what has this Hotel so high on my list. Ask and you will receive. A particular shout out to the Wisconsin Football team who helped to make it special for my son by having every player and the coach sign his football the day before the game!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Hexagone6x6
Reviews.Content: I was there on a business trip. This is a giant hotel complex next to the Staples Center. The hotel has a spectacular lobby, the room was spacious, quiet and luxurious. Restaurants in the hotel were more than adequate. The meeting rooms were well equipped. Overall, nice place to stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for events at LA Live, gotta drive to see the rest of the city”
Reviews.Author: luvs_trvl_and_dogs
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott still feels extremely new - everything is clean, modern, and well thought out. The Marriott shares the lobby with the Ritz Carlton, which is also part of the complex, and the set up is clearly geared toward the RC level. It could just be my visit, but everything seems focused on the sports and the events at the Staples Center. The hotel was full of Wisconsin fans here for the Rose Bowl as well as hockey fans watching the Kings play next door. It gave the hotel a great energy, but also meant things like the restaurant was crowded for breakfast and the bars full at night. The room was large, comfortable, and well designed. Despite the hotel being packed, I didn't hear hall noise or any noise from other rooms. Internet is $13 per day and works well. To explore the rest of LA you really need to drive to see the city. Parking is steep at $40 and is only available via valet, which I dislike. I really wish hotels always have a self-park option. I really don't need someone to park my car for me. Overall, I was pleased with the stay and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Large and beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: Out_of_valley
Reviews.Content: My room was large because I paid 10% more to get an Executive King room, which is 40% larger than the normal (Deluxe) room. It is well worth it. I stayed in a Deluxe room on a previous visit and the modern decor was elegant both times. The hotel lobby is large and beautiful. The gym is excellent, although for some reason they seem to have two of one type of weight machine and none of another (i.e., two lat pulldown machines, but no low row.) My room was right next to the elevators and I could occasionally hear the machinery, but it was not bad, and I am very sensitive to noise. Many hotels have heating and/or A/C systems that are noisy, but this one was quiet, so it was easy to get a good night's sleep. I was on the north side of the building, away from LA Live, so there was no noise from their music etc. But on the previous visit I was facing LA Live and noise was not a problem. There is, however, one problem, and that is not with the hotel itself, but with its location. If you are going to an event at the Staples Center or the Convention Center, they are just a few steps away. But if you are not driving and want to visit the main part of downtown L.A. or go someplace else in L.A., you either have to walk four blocks to the Red Line subway stop or DASH (Downtown Area Shuttle) bus stop at 7th Street, or take the F DASH bus on Figueroa Street, right by LA Live. The F DASH runs every 10 minutes on weekdays and every 20 minutes on weekends.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't think I would like it”
Reviews.Author: Jean-BaptisteCol
Reviews.Content: This giant hotel complex is in LA's stadium district. I must admit, in spite of the spectacular lobby, I didn't think I would like it. I thought it was a bit Las Vegas. However, the rooms were spacious, quiet and luxurious with duvets and chamomile tea and high quality soaps. Only drawback was that Wifi too expensive and didn't work well. It didn't work for a couple hours and when I told the staff, I was not comped, which I thought was odd. But otherwise, the staff was great and the pool very nice and big enough for laps. Overall, its an excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Price”
Reviews.Author: scottsuemc
Reviews.Content: For the price of deluxe room....really??? They charge $12.95 a day for internet use...only 1 bathrobe...only 1 regular coffee for single coffee maker...and no mini bar??? You had to use your card for elevator...but it was so loud in elevator we couldn't hear the stupid thing telling us to use card!! Good luck finding the lights in your room if you arrive in evening also!!

Reviews.Title: “A great modern hotel in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Lauren502
Reviews.Content: I really loved this property. It felt fresh and contemporary compared to many other hotels. You can't beat the location next to LA Live and the Convention Center. The lobby area/restaurants/bars are all great and the pool area is amazing. The rooms are spacious and clean. The bathroom is nice and large, but it was lacking a tub.

Reviews.Title: “living the glamourous life!”
Reviews.Author: msbrown5804
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. I walked into the lobby and saw the best hotel gift shop I have ever seen. In fact, I bought a dress and purse before I even registered. Everyone was super friendly, from the registration desk, to the restaurant manager, the waitstaff, the room service girl, the bellman. I felt like I made a whole new group of friends. I didn't get a chance to try the gorgeous pool, because it was the week of the Big Wind. My room was so beautiful I took pictures of it for Facebook. Design plus! The only thing I wasn't sure I loved was that my room overlooked a 30 story electronic billboard. I pretended I was in Tokyo. But I also could see the Nokia Theater and Staples Center, so I didn't ask to change rooms. I would stay here again, anytime. In fact, I would LIVE here!! ( p.s I did not have a car,but you can rent one from Hertz right in the hotel, AND return it to the airport)

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous new hotel”
Reviews.Author: dancingvix
Reviews.Content: Well I was there these past 10 days since I was working at the LA Auto Show at the convention center. Last year I stayed at the Westin (see review). So, I have to admit that this location is definitly MUCH better. Much more within a 3 block radius, including a supermarket, Ralphs. The hotel is brand new. The rooms are spacious, the bathrooms are huge. The pool on the 4th floor is gorgeous, and I LOVED the Illy caffe in the lobby...my favorite coffee place...sure beats starbucks anyday. That being said theres a starbucks within steps from the hotel..as is so many restaurants, and the staples center! Now as far as service...I guess it was fine. Nothing in particular happened for them to demonstrate extraordinary service, but they were always friendly from the moment I arrived to the moment I left. Now I just had 2 complaints. ONE, no free wifi/internet in the room. Its $12.95 a day!!! I thought this is ridiculous since this isnt a run of the mill hotel. BUT!!!! i found out the way around it! ish! There IS free wifi in the lobby. So you can connect to the wifi in the lobby then go to your room and you have a free hour! et voila! The other thing is that they dont provide microwaves. Now if you are only staying a few days, who cares, but since I was there for almost 2 weeks, to save money I bought alot of groceries and it would of been nice to have (as i had in the westin). So considering that was my only 2 complaints, which neither are too significant, I definitely give this hotel 5 stars!!! And did I mention the pool area is GORGEOUS!

Reviews.Title: “$40 valet parking per day”
Reviews.Author: Silvia P
Reviews.Content: We checked in knowing parking would cost $40 because we researched it from their website. We looked for alternative parking across the street, which is $20 per day. The hotel is very nice and clean, the executive lounge is great. We got a junior suite and it was very pleasing. However the pool was rooftop pool and it was too cold to use in November. The hotel is not very family friendly, we asked for a coloring book and crayon because our austistic son likes to color, they did not have it. The Westin will give your children a 'kids club' bag full of activities and toys. Which is GREAT! after a long day you deserve to have a few moments with your kids happy. And if you are a marriott platinum/gold member, don't expect them to give you complementry breakfast on Sunday when their executive lounge is closed. They don't give you breakfast voucher to make up for that. Their housekeeps/bellman does great a job!!!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: globalpilot
Reviews.Content: Decided to use this hotel for a family Thanksgiving vacation due to its great location. About 5 days prior to check in I received an email from Karen Sales who is the hotels Elite Guest Coordinatior advising me that the concierge lounge would we closed during my stay. She said they would provide coupons for breakfast at the breakfast buffet. I asked if she could comp the valet parking which is $40/night and to her credit she did. At check in I was offered and upgrade to a suite which was huge and head great views. The room was fantastic and gave us a lot of extra space. All the staff at this hotel were outstanding. I requested the couch be made up for sleeping and a rollaway made up and within 5 minutes they were at the door. The valet parking is very convenient. The buffet breakfast was wonderful, with the best french toast ever. The only negative I can think of is the bathroom. It was huge with an oversized shower but the rainhead shower head the water comes out like a slow drip. A bathtub would have been nice also. Thank you Marriot for a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite property in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: mgtravles
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively for business and pleasure, and always choose this property when I need to be downtown. Great location surrounded by restaurants and entertainment, while the rooms are clean and comfortable. The food on property is always good - love the breakfast bar.

Reviews.Title: “So much to do in the immediate area”
Reviews.Author: durcat
Reviews.Content: The JW Marriott at LA Live is a beautiful hotel in a great location. It was the LA version of Times Square in NYC. The sleeping rooms are large and very contemporary, with little extras to make you feel like you are staying in a luxurious hotel. Check-in and check-out were quick and accurate. The meeting room space is very nice. The lobby area is bright and sunny; a good spot for 'star' gazing. Just a few steps from the hotel are numerous restaurants with reasonable prices. The area is well lit and seemed very safe at night. I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay”
Reviews.Author: MikeH98
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the JW Marriott for 4 days as part of a conference and were very happy with the experience. Check in was prompt, our room was large (and slightly retro in decor) with a view of the Hollywood sign. Breakfast was fine and we used the Italian coffee shop also. We used the gym regularly and the pool looked nice as well. Staff were really friendly but not too in your face. LA Live is lively in the evening, safe to walk around and with a wide choice of restaurants. We walked to the metro and rode up to Universal Studio's in around 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Downtown by far!”
Reviews.Author: VancouverTraveler-11
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Walk in the door and you are greeted with a smile and a very personable staff member. The rooms are spacious and clean. The location is great for anything at Staples, LA Convention Centre or Nokia Theatre. Many great resturaunts right there in the LA Live complex. There are even others if you want to walk a bit. Don't let anyone warn you off the area. Maybe a few years ago it was a little risky, but my wife and I walked 7 blocks to a great Italian place to eat and felt fine walking after 8:pm. Sure you may come across one homeless person that may ask you for a buck, but what big city do you not get that. Great bar areas and again the servers are very pleasant. Make sure the price is OK for you and the extra parking charges etc. but well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Good lodging in the isolation of LA LIVE”
Reviews.Author: Oshawott
Reviews.Content: LA Live area is a entertainment complex in the desolation of downtown LA. There is a reason they think they can build an NFL stadium there, they can level blocks. Currently there is a concert venue, sports arena, a movie multiplex and a variety of theme restaurants of various quality. The hotel is part of the complex and is in the same building as the Ritz Carlton. In fact they share some of the same facilities, such as the lobby bars, parking and fitness center. So between the two stay at the Marriott for less. Room was nice, clean, modern with nice view from 18th floor. Comfortable bed. Had mini fridge, but not stocked. Room service for breakfast was quite good and punctual. Staff was nice as well. However given location would only stay if going to event at LA Live. As is far from everything that makes LA, LA

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location - stellar JW”
Reviews.Author: DougUtah
Reviews.Content: This JW is ideally located downtown. It is next to the arena and in walking proximity of terrific restaurants. I had a spacious suite with an enormous bathroom. This property is absolutely my first Los Angeles choice.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for conferences but no great shakes”
Reviews.Author: Chicago60604
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a conference recently. The hotel is quite large but for access to events at the convention or Staples Center it is fine. Otherwise nothing is really within a comfortable walking distance. The reception, bar and restaurant areas are an open plan and feels somewhat disjointed, certainly with no feeling of intimacy anywhere. I was in an executive king room which was oddly shaped. It was attractive looking but some practical design flaws are actually annoying (shades that are difficult to raise and lower, lights not well attached to the wall, cool water for showers in the morning, and no light in or near the closet unit) On the good side the bed was comfortable and the bathroom well designed with lots of a shelf space and a very large shower. All in all my stay was acceptable but I would not stay again barring a conference located there

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and elegant. Wish I had a longer stay.”
Reviews.Author: srk3465
Reviews.Content: Stayef here one night for a meeting on site. Arrived late in evening and had to leave by 1 pm the next day. While my stay was short, sometimes you can tell how good (or bad) a place really is. Location is right next to Staple Center. While I didn't get chance to venture outside it looked like there was a lot there. Check in was smooth and when I asked for a room with view, they gave me choice and ended up with small upgrade to executive room. Room size was awesome, very spacious though to be fair, I am not sure how a standard room would be in size. TV was a big flat screen, bed was exceptionally comfortable. Had room service since everything was closed by the time I checked in. Food arrived on time and burger was better than most, as was the soup. Bathroom was also spacious and great shower. Checkout was smooth. Meeting rooms were a short indoor walk to attached building. Overall experience was so good that I wished I had a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can not wait to stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: macca_au
Reviews.Content: First stop on a six week family holiday and the hotel did not disappoint. We enjoyed three fantastic nights. Room size was very generous and we did not feel like there was a roll away bed in the room. The main bed was very very comfortable and the roll away was of a very high standard. Our eight year old loved the in room entertainment which is one of the best I have seen in any hotel. Was slightly disappointing to have some sort of "sticker" on the outside of our room window that made up part of a large advertisement. The view of the city was somewhat obscured. Standard of staff, fit out, food and cleanliness was extremely high. Warm friendly staff were always ready to help. The wait service at breakfast was a little confusing and slow but made up for by a very high standard of food. The hotel has a great location and provides for easy access to LA Live and the city centre. The hotel has easy access to the metro network but we did feel slightly uncomfortable on the walk through some remote parking areas. The concierge lounge was one of the top three I have had the pleasure of using. The standard of the food was high and staff were warm and welcoming. Lounge fit out was very good and the available technology worked! Really looking forward to staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs improvement in some areas”
Reviews.Author: tjjlucas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 2 nights this past week. First the positive: Front desk and concierge service is top notch. Rooms are spacious and clean. The location Is great if you are attending an event. Areas that need serious improvement: The service in both the lobby lounge and the mixing longe is absolutely terrible. On a Monday evening we went to the mixing lounge and sat at a table (the bar was full but the seating area only had 8 people seated) and waited for approximately 10 minutes to order. There were 2 waitresses working but seemed to be more interested in talking to each other than serving customers. I finally went to the bar and ordered. In the hour I was seated at a table not 1 of the staff asked if I would like anything else or even approached me. this is unacceptable particularly when you are paying top $$ for cocktails. The lobby bar is not much better. I was also really disappointed in the housekeeping service. I left my room at approx. 1 PM and saw that housekeeping was servicing the adjacent room. I returned to my room at 5PM and the room had not been cleaned. I spoke with the front desk and they acted like it was no big deal and they would have someone service it. I'm sorry but at $300+ a night it was a big deal to me. The gym is great but he again the staff really need to work on their customer service skills. Too long of a story to bother with... For $300+ a night there should be free internet service for all guests in their room. Also, be aware that overnight parking charges are ridiculous at $40 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort at LA Convention”
Reviews.Author: richiedoc
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located near the convention center and Staples arena, this 18 month old hotel leaves little to be desired. A courteous and gracious staff welcomes visitors to a striking contemporary lobby atrium. Guests may access several food and drink emporiums located around or in the lobby atrium. Spacious, quiet, large, and well appointed bright rooms with ample work space characterize offerings. As a media geek I appreciated the media center connections and large screen HD TV. The large and well outfitted fitness facility has a wide variety of equipment. The hotel's web site has an excellent gallery of photos that unlike my photos do justice to the properties' beauty. A comfortable bed, refrigerator and coffee maker and a safe in the room make for a comfortable stay. Best description of the property is attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent downtown hotel!”
Reviews.Author: timdsd
Reviews.Content: I had a very good stay at the JW Marriott while I was in town for the LA Half Marathon in late October. The hotel is modern and clean, and my room was big, quiet, and comfortable. The bed was just right - not too soft and not too firm. I noticed a hum from the air conditioner, but I just turned it off at night since it the weather was so mild. Everywhere in the hotel, I found the staff to be helpful and very courteous. They made for a pleasant stay. The shower head seemed to be of the water-saving variety, but there was adequate water pressure for a good, hot shower. I noticed LED lighting in the hall outside the elevator on my floor, and presume the hotel was built to modern energy-saving standards. The rooftop pool looked very really inviting, but I didn't have time to use it. At 5pm on a warm Saturday it was surprisingly empty. I had been skeptical that the convenient LA Live location would be noisy and crowded, but it was fine. Driving to and from the hotel was no worse than the rest of downtown LA, and I felt very comfortable walking around the neighborhood. The parking valet person told me I'd get a discount on parking because I drove a hybrid car, although at checkout they missed the discount so I had to remind them. All downtown LA hotel parking is expensive, so I was thrilled to get a substantial discount. The valet pickup area was very busy, but the wait to get my car was less than 10 minutes. While nearby hotels like the Millennium Biltmore offer great old world charm, this JW Marriott is a great contemporary hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Shaddick
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay. The rooms were very clean, pleasant staff, nice restaurant, the 4th floor rooftop pool was great, and it's in a great area! Easily walk to several restaurants, cinemas, shopping, the Staples Center, Nokia Theater etc... The only thing that surprised us was if you have a car, it's $40 to park/day; they only have valet parking and the closest parking structure charges $30, isn't open 24 hours and you would have to move daily.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the events....”
Reviews.Author: Bahrain_Bill
Reviews.Content: The JW is a great location for downtown LA, whether it be for business or for events at the Staples, Nokia and other venues. The hotel is customer friendly and the rooms are large and nicely furnished with great bathrooms. There are lots restaurants all around the vicinity and the area is safe and friendly. We stayed as we were settling my daughter into FIDM which is just around the corner. Walking up town to the financial and shopping areas is also not a problem. Santa Monica is easily acceptable with the freeway adjacent and the airport is a 20 mins (weekend) $50 ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Visiting USC”
Reviews.Author: Tropean
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night visit at this hotel, where we stayed while we attended Family Weekend at the University of Southern California. For anything USC-related, this hotel would be hard to beat; it's maybe a mile straight down Figueroa to campus. Many of the other reviews have captured the essential pros and cons of the place (good room sizes, all of the restaurants and activity associated with LA Live, cool design factor, good TVs, etc.). The reason I knocked a star off of my review this time was the extra charge ($12.95 per day) for wireless internet service, which in late 2011 I believe is a straight-up ripoff, and the fact that the general level of maintenance / upkeep / housekeeping was not, for me, at the 5 star level. Rest assured that none of the issues would keep me from staying here again - and I probably will - but just a little thing here and there could have been better. But overall a terrific choice for downtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: sk9758
Reviews.Content: I arrived early at the hotel and although my specific room was not ready , the gentleman at the reception was kind enough to give me a regular room on the 4th floor and promised to inform me once the specific room would be ready. True to his promise, he called me up after 3 hours and sent the new room key up for me. What a different feeling a room can make!!! The first one was on a low floor and an ordinary room. This one was on the 21st floor and a junior suite. Upon entering I marveled at the size of the room and the clever planning of its spaces. It had a large bedroom area and a large sitting room and work area. The bathroom was very big and had a shower stall but no bath tub. The view was excellent too. Being a platinum elite member I had access to the lounge and free internet as well. The room and the beds were one the most comfortable ones. Toiletries were of high quality and the lounge offerings were very good too.
