I was not aware of all of the restaurants available in the plaza (Fleming's, The Yard House, ESPN Zone, Trader Vic's). I was very impressed. But not nearly as much as I was by the hospitality at the J. W. Marriott. The reception was prompt and efficient. The room was pristine and clean. The amenities were better than most. The experience was exceptional. HIGH POINTS: Good value for the dollar in an exceptional location for any event at Staples Center, the Nokia Theater or L.A. Live. Staff is efficient yet when it was time to go to our room, they walked us to the elevator. The rooms are as clean as a whistle. The valet parking was easy. To pick up your car you have to go to a basement level...again, very efficient. LOW POINTS: When their informal restaurant closes from 2:00 pm to 5:00 pm, they direct you to their lobby bar. We ordered a couple drinks and a hummus plate. After waiting half an hour (and while others were served) my wife went back to the room to get ready for the evening and I insisted my waitress bring me the bill, absent the charge for food we never received. She had to get a manager to approve that....another couple minutes went by. The manager finally appeared, apologized, and explained someone had failed to show up for their shift. She thanked me for my patience. I felt that was not enough. Absent that underwhelming experience, our stay at the J. W. Marriott was a pleasant one. After my wife was all dolled up we used the interior passage in the hotel to go through to the adjoining Ritz Carlton and took their elevator to the WP24 Lounge. The "WP" stands for Wolfgang Puck and the "24" stands for the 24th floor. We had drinks and appetizers before going to our show.

Reviews.Title: “Best Trained Employees of Any Hotel I've Stayed”
Reviews.Author: maltasr
Reviews.Content: As the title says, this hotel has the most quality employees I've ever seen at any hotel. When I arrived by car, the valet personally escorted me to the front desk, introduced me to the agent behind the counter, and informed us he would help us with anything within his domain. The gal behind the counter said that because I was a Platinum Elite, they had reserved a junior suite that was corner located. We had a terrific view of the Staples Center, Nokia Center, Restaurant Row including Wolfgang Puck's upscale establishment. The view also included the large near-Olympic sized pool, 18 person jacuzzi, and several very large and private pool cabanas. Our junior suite measured 700 square feet which is quite large by most hotel standards. The hotel included a large dining room called "The Market" which seated 150 diners for breakfast, lunch and dinner and was quite good. It was also very busy, particularly in the evening when a lot of LA residents came into town for a look at the new LA Live complex. There was also an upscale coffee house and a very large cocktail lounge that featured live music nightly. I was on the Concierge Level so got to partake of the great breakfasts, snacks, and desserts. There were also several Lenovo computers in the lounge that guests could use. I had a conference rate of $120/night which is far below the rack rate of around $300. I don't know how the company was able to negotiate such attractive rates although they did reserve one thousand rooms. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great palce to rest your head”
Reviews.Author: Roughrider5208
Reviews.Content: What a great location. Next to the Nokia Center and Staple Center. Something going on there ALL THE TIME. Lots of resaurants and bars near by. Never have to leave the area for entertainment. The hotel in top of the line. Everything about it is TOP NOTCH. Great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Convenient, Modern and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: DC-Logan
Reviews.Content: Attended a large conference in October and the room was booked by our company. Overall the stay was fine; it's a new hotel, so everything has a new modern feel. Almost feels like a Kimpton or W design. My room only had a shower, no tub; so be sure to check if you want a tub for soaking. The room was smaller than expected; but was not there much except to sleep and beds were very comfortable and the room was quiet which is most important on a business trip. It is nice to have a fridge in the room for extra water and leftovers. Room service was very good one night, and then one morning they delivered my breakfast very late. The location is great if you are attending a conference at the convention center or any of the venues around LA Live. We did not leave that particular area for nearly a week. If you like good wines, the wine bar in the lobby has a great selection and the staff was very knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disappointed by the service”
Reviews.Author: tazosaure
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, clean, chic hotel but it being a Marriott/4 stars I was a bit disappointed by the service at times. I was traveling for business as I was attending a conference at the next door conference center, and my wife was accompanying me as she wanted to enjoy/discover downtown LA. The good: rooms have top of line amenities (flat screen HD TV, iPod alarm clocks, etc) really comfortable beds and beautiful bathrooms. Besides the hotel's own restaurant there's plenty of good eateries right on the plaza, so no need to drive around! The valet parking staff were really nice and efficient. The bad: I had booked a king bed room but by the time we arrived (around 5pm on the sunday before the conference) they were fully booked and somehow no king room left besides my reservation. No apologies about it. I was told at the desk we would have 2 queens instead, which is fine by me as we sleep on a queen at home, but once in the room it turns out it was really 2 doubles. A bit tight for my wife and I, so we ended up sleeping in separate beds for the length stay, far from ideal... Apart from that first mishap, the bathtub's plug/drain stopper was not working making it impossible for my wife to relax from the trip in bath on the first night, no big deal but it took 3 requests (each spaced out by a couple of hours) to finally have someone come up and fix it. At checkout, we were rushed through, no one ever asked us how was our stay, I guess they didn't care, I was hoping to be able to voice my disappointment then but I was not given the opportunity so here you go.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay at JW Marriot at LA Live”
Reviews.Author: birdmen1637
Reviews.Content: JW Marriot at LA Live is fantastic. Highly recommend it. Stayed there during the Gartner conference. The room was very spacious and nicely decorated. the big flat screen hd tv was an unexpected surprise. the bed was very comfortable. the room was quiet and I slept great. the LA Market restaurant in the hotel was really good. there's also a number of good restaurants near by. ate at ESPN Sportszone and Rock Fish, both of which were very good. the hot tub and pool were very nice. loved watching the projected tv images on the building from the hot tub at night. visible security in the hotel as well outside in the LA Live area so felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome new facilities”
Reviews.Author: mojo2012oovajay
Reviews.Content: Fabulous new hotel with great rooms, very good food, convenient location (for Central LA, etc..), spacious up to date gym, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great if location if you want to eat, or spend time at LA Live”
Reviews.Author: famluvtravel
Reviews.Content: I spent four nights at the hotel for a conference in November. As a conference facility it was great. As a hotel, it lived up to high expectations. Check in was smooth and easy. In fact, I think it was probably the friendliest check-in I have ever had. Even though check-in was 4 pm, there were no questions asked about checking in at noon. Room was spacious with all the amenities you would expect from a hotel of this caliber. Shower was amazing. Bathroom was huge. There was a couch, chair, desk, and huge Plasma TV with lots of HD options. For the business traveler, the hookups are available to charge pda's even easily hook your laptop up to the television. Lots of choice to eat inside the hotel, but steps from the hotel you have countless great restaurants to choose from. Steps for the Nokia Theater and the Staples Center.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, great service, super clean.”
Reviews.Author: metaleyelash
Reviews.Content: I had forgotten a ladies' shaver and asked the hotel if they could bring one to my room. This was at 11pm and it was there in five minutes, along with a complimentary little can of shaving cream! I left the cleaning staff a $15 tip because they did such a great job for the three days that I was there. Expensive, but highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel and you are right in the middle of all the action”
Reviews.Author: Crowleymagic
Reviews.Content: Only 1 year old and it has that new modern look. Service was excellent from front desk to room service. You are in the heart of the LA Live scene with concerts, Lakers/Kings games and restaurants. Sitting out on the square and watching the people come and go is entertaining in itself. Hotel is very nice and complaints are minimal. Elevators are confusing and you have to use your room key every time (pain!); water pressure is not good in showers but I guess we are trying to be "green". Beds are great. If you are in LA for a show or game definitely stay here. Only other negative note for us is there is not a nice sit down restaurant. They are all "bars" that serve food. They todl us the steak restaurant did not make it and they are waiting for a new idea.

Reviews.Title: “Thank goodness I got to stay here instead of the Radisson!”
Reviews.Author: kathleen_1227
Reviews.Content: I was in town to attend a conference at USC. The conference said to stay at the radisson, so I made my reservation there. Days before the conference, I checked the Radisson reviews on Trip Advisor, and thank goodness I did. The reviews were HORRIBLE, so I quickly found another hotel near campus. Trip Advisor to the rescue! The JW Marriott is right next to the Staples Center and had a little promenade right outside the door with Times Square style bright lights. For me as a solo traveler, it was perfect. I hardly stepped out the door and I had a choice of about 10-12 restaurants. I got dinner at Wolfgang Puck one night and Rosa Mexicano the next. I felt totally safe those few feet outisde the hotel. My room was quite spacious and modern, and the bathroom was big with a beautiful shower and nice shampoo, conditioner, etc. Nice big flatscreen TV that didn't get great TV reception, but it wasn't a big deal. I used the gym both mornings and that was very nice too, down to providing towels, fruit water, and cardio machines with their own TV/iPod hookups. I didn't get to check out the pool or spa. My last morning, I went to get a cab to USC (about 2 miles away), and instead I got a complimentary ride from one of the two Marriott Escalades! I felt tlike a big cheese. For transportation betwen the hotel and LAX, Super Shuttle is only $16/way, whereas a cab is $47/way. As a business traveler, the Marriott was more than I was hoping for.

Reviews.Title: “Great for few days, J.W. standard”
Reviews.Author: enjoyer80
Reviews.Content: Ou Honeymoon started in LA, and first two nights were in J.W. When we arrived ( rented a car at the airport), we had to get a police escort for few blocks as around was closed and full of police. Reason: 7th game of this years NBA finals between Lakers and Celtics. It was a crazy atmosphere. Hotel is next to Staples Centre, and that is why the whole hotel lobby, bar and restaurant was crowded. Hundreds of people were cheering for Lakers ( they won!! ). As hotel is brand new, I experienced some slowliness at the reception, but nothing worse. Room was great, comfortable; parking not so expensive as I expected; They have a nice business centre; we did not try other facilities, as mosty we were driving around;

Reviews.Title: “Best location for Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: dagnytaggart
Reviews.Content: Was here 3rd week in September for a Convention. Also stayed here twice earlier this year planning for the same event. Good points: It's more like a W than a Marriott, so the design is nice. Bed is pretty comfy. the weird one-arm orange couch in the room, also comfy. Bathrooms are nice with good amenities. I like the armoire and the little table at the front of the room with the coffee machine is a benefit. I like to finish the evening with a cup of tea, so it's nice to be able to do that. Big TV was also nice. Proximity to Starbucks is good. LA Live is great all around. The Wolfgang Puck is a stellar restaurant. Pricey, but stellar. Medicore points: Room service options aren't great. They were kind enough to give me extra water when they messed up my order, but the food was just OK. Desk is not all that workable a space. Not too comfy to sit at for long periods. Bad points: Overall hotel service isn't great. You have to ask for things over and over and over. It can get irritating. Can be pricey, both in terms of food and actual room price, because of proximity to the Convention Center. You can probably get more for your money if you don't stay so close. Restaurant in lobby is just OK. Bottom line--if you're going to a convention and can't afford the Ritz, this is the place. It's too close not to.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown location - nice, new hotel”
Reviews.Author: KramerNashville
Reviews.Content: Excellent location beside the convention center, Nokia Center, and Staples Center. Trendy, nicely decorated and very clean room. An easy $16 Super Shuttle (www.supershuttle.com) ride from LAX; split a $60 taxi fare between colleagues on the return trip to LAX. Hotel restaurant takes reservations for breakfast, which is a must, especially considering how SLOW the service was, but the food was good. Several nice restaurants within easy walking distance, including a very busy Starbucks as a quick alternative for breakfast, instead of the expensive SLOW hotel restaurant. Nice fitness center with plenty of weights, treadmills, elipticals, etc. Awesome looking rooftop pool, which I didn't have the opportunity to use. Didn't need parking, but it is very expensive at $38. Also, passed on the daily internet rate of $12. Adjacent to Ritz Carlton. No better location if you have a convention at the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean place”
Reviews.Author: blue_alto
Reviews.Content: The Marriott was really a fantastic facility. While I would not have immediately chosen to stay downtown had this not been for a business conference, the location was convenient to lots of restaurants and some entertainment. While the Metro was not entirely convenient, this seemed to be a fairly safe area to walk (I even went for a run alone at 6:30 a.m. two mornings, and I'm fairly slightly built woman). Free water was a nice touch, and conference accommodations and food were out of this world! Nice, spacious rooms and bathrooms, and the hotel overall seemed quite to this light sleeper. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Call place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JoaoCardosoFernandes
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel it's in Downtown LA, with lot's of traffic and people (during the night), it's a calm place to stay, with an amazing swimming pool. By the side of the hotel, you have the tower of the Ritz-Carlton, but it doesn't take any of the charm and beauty of JW Marriot. It's a brand new hotel, with warming staff, and very nice rooms. And the products in the bathroom - OUTSTANDING!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: MarkCWales
Reviews.Content: I was filled with dread -- a convention hotel is usually pretty mediocre. This one was fantastic. The staff were friendly from check in to check out and, mostly, very efficient (it took 2 calls and 30 minutes to get foam pillows but that was the only flaw). I had expected the usual deliberately-dowdy Marriott too but this hotel was smart, contemporary and looked very slick Rooms were excellent -- quiet, comfortable and with proper duvet covers on great beds. Even the room service and laundry prices were reasonable. Although $35 a day for parking is a little steep -- I wish I had noticed the lot across the street Very, very impressive

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel next to Staples Center”
Reviews.Author: hqstir
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Labor Day weekend for concert at Staples. One block to Staples and convention center; 3 blocks to downtown. New, spacious rooms with frig and safe. Beds were nice and comfy and room was very quiet (maybe cuz hotel not that busy?). Lobby is airy and has free wi-fi! Unfortunately, no free wi-fi in rooms. 4th floor pool was nice and overlooked LA Live. Draft beer at bar was $8 but soda from vending machines were only $1.25! Valet parking is expensive but no free parking in area.

Reviews.Title: “Block Rooms”
Reviews.Author: shamaticgrl
Reviews.Content: In late July 2010 and all of August JW Marriott and I formed a contract for a block room for SM Town LA 2010. I set up 21 rooms and JW had said they would arrange the rooms to be on the same floor and provide us with 2 double beds since there wil be 78 people arriving for the concert. I called in 5 days prior the check in date and they told me everything was fine and all rooms are ready and early check in was fine as well. Once I got there all our rooms were scattered throughout the hotel. One room was on the 11th floor, 3 rooms on the 12th, 8 rooms on the 16th and 1 room was on the 19th floor. I called our event manager but they never picked up or responded back to me as usual since their schedule is from Monday-Thrus. What was even more annoying was some of the rooms had king beds instead of 2 double beds. Basically if you're doing a block order of 10 or more rooms JW is horrible for the job. The hotel was beautiful but I would have enjoyed it with all my hard work paid off and I could enjoy more time with my group instead of traveling up and down the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “JW Marriott Live, LA”
Reviews.Author: JulieGNC
Reviews.Content: K, the cafe is awesome, food is great. The service is 5 star. The rooms are very nice. Of course the beds are comfortable because it's a Marriott. The shower head, OMG - best shower of my life. Nice central location. Parking fee's are a rip off but that's probably the case no matter where you go. Restaurants in the general walking area are all pretty much a wash, your better off eating at the hotel which has very good food or heading out a little farther from the hotel if you want a really good meal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Wekend at L.A. Live”
Reviews.Author: kathleenmarie
Reviews.Content: The new J.W. Marriott is a great trendy hotel. The corner room we had was very nice and had GREAT views. We do not live far from the city but wanted to try to new hotel. We were very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good for a Marriott!!!”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityGuy
Reviews.Content: I am far from a fan of most Marriott hotels (I think they are dated, ugly, inconsistent), but enjoy staying at a JW from time to time. The LA Live property is quite good and worth a return visit. I was given a 12th floor "City View", which consisted of a view of the LA Live facility, which was perfect for me. Room was very clean; I requested a quiet room and definitely got that--at the end of a hallway next to what appeared to be an occupied corner room/suite. The only drawbacks I could find was the price of internet, no free newspaper (important for me when I travel for business or pleasure) and no express checkout. Overall, a great stay in a great location if you are looking to hang in your room and just go out to eat or have a beer.

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern, Fun Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lemiracle
Reviews.Content: The one drawback: my brother and I, huge Boston Celtics fans, threw open the blinds of our JW Marriott hotel room and realized that we were staring directly at the Staples Center, ie the home of the LA Lakers (who, alas, just beat the C's in that very building in Game 7 of the Finals just a month before). Arrrrgh. Ok, that's obviously not a real problem. We spent three nights here last month and completely enjoyed our stay. Though I love some of LA's other areas, it made sense for us to be downtown, and this location is well-situated. You're a 5-minute drive into the traditional downtown (we spent one evening at the rooftop bar at the Downtown Standard), 10-15 minutes to Dodger Stadium, and the hotel sits right near the I-10 and the I-110, so it's easy to connect to just about any freeway. The other bonus about the location: it sits next to the surprisingly vibrant LA Live development. In addition to the Staples Center (booo), the Nokia Theater is right there and there are a slew of bars and restaurants (we saw Don Mattingly at the YardHouse one afternoon). There's a Starbucks too, which was even busy on a Sunday morning. While we there, the development's courtyard was being converted into a stage for the X Games. We didn't notice any of the growing pains or kinks that some of the other reviewers did. Our very modern room was fairly big, had a nice TV, two comfortable beds, etc. The bathroom didn't have a lock, true, but no other coplaints. The staff seemed friendly. It's a touch pricey, but we didn't notice because we had two free nights thanks to my brother's Marriott points. We spent one afternoon in the pool (it's atop the 4th floor), which also features an outdoor bar and lounge. It hosted a private party one day, which drew a big crowd, but you couldn't hear the music from the rooms. The lobby is huge and cool, though the bar was really overpriced. One legit negative: the valet parking is $38, and there's almost no way to avoid it. All of the lots and garages nearby charge at least that for overnight parking, and there didn't seem to be any legal street spaces. And, obviously, you need a car in LA. That aside, we had a great stay and would certainly return. Hopefully after a Celtics win next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in downtown L.A.”
Reviews.Author: cwfrei
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is a nice hotel but not worth its regular price. The location is all right if you attend an event at Staples and want to discover L.A. Live. To visit downtown LA including Little Tokyo and Chinatown you must calculate one entire day. The price for the car overnight parking at the hotel is with USD 38 absolutely crazy and not justified. We did park our car on the other side of the road (next to a car wash) and we've paid USD 20 (still enought). On the day of departure no one from the hotel would help us with our luggage as the staff saw that we've parked the car on the other side and they didn't make money on us so they ignored us even if 3 of them were standing around at the hotel entrance. They still need a lot of training...

Reviews.Title: “Quirky top quality JW Marriott with OUTSTANDING staff and service.”
Reviews.Author: Tanya33467
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in Hollywood when visiting LA but was interested in the revamped downtown are this time. I am so thrilled that I did. This LA live property is Marriott on fresh steroids, with thrilling contemporary design and a trained service-oriented staff that feels empowered to make each guest stay unique and exceptional. From the welcome and room adjustment by the front desk to each interaction with staff, I felt like a super star traveling incognito. I am a loyal Marriott traveller but this was a little different and notable, I am still at the property and thrilled that I have three more nights. From the illy coffee in the lobby instead of the ubiquitous Starbucks, each detail of this place simply feels right to me, and the bathrooms are the bomb from design to amenities. Oh and can't forget rooftop pool and nightspot. Sweet. Enjoy your stay here.

Reviews.Title: “It had potential - its just all wrong though.”
Reviews.Author: AlbionbytheSea
Reviews.Content: This hotel has enough issues that it ends up being annoying. $38 for parking, free internet in the lobby, but $13 in the room (why is it that hotel paying guests pay for internet, but walkins off the street get it for free - hotels need to fix this), elevators that require the room card to be inserted before selecting a floor (but only on one side of the elevator, you can't insert the card on both sides - so you are all crawling over each over in the elevators trying to get your floor 'approved'), bad connecting door soundproofing - plenty of noise travels between rooms - very annoying, check in isn't until 4pm, and even then rooms weren't ready, and lastly LA Live - there really is nothing to do here - you are just stuck in downtown LA with views of parking lots and freeways with just a few chain restaurants around you. Truly, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking, nice rooms, but the worst soundproofing make it terrible.”
Reviews.Author: jdbnyc
Reviews.Content: The new hotel is beautiful, chic. The rooms quite spacious and pretty, very nice bathroom. But --and this is huge-- I had one of the worst experiences ever. I had a room with a connecting room door. all night I could hear the television the other room's guests were listening to: not the muffled sound of a television, the word for word exact dialogue of the program. And the tv was not on loud. I could also hear the exact conversations of the guests, who were not speaking loudly. I could not sleep, as every sound, cough, grunt, from the room next door sounded like it was in mine. When I told the check out desk of this they told me they have this problem with all rooms with connecting room doors and lowered my bill, which did not return one minute of rest or comfort to my stay. Really dreadful.

Reviews.Title: “Miko 40th Birthday celebration”
Reviews.Author: jessiegenie
Reviews.Content: it was my boyfriend 40th birthday and we were doing a bar crawl in downtown la, so we needed a place to lay our heads. We picked the Marriot for its location location location. Upon entering you see the massive beautiful lobby which is adjacent to their bar..The hotel is modern/contempory, its in the heart of downtown. The rooms are spacious and the beds are comfy! We didn't use the pool but we can seen it from our room, it looked nice with a huge jacuzzy. I would recommend this hotel is you going to a laker game or exploring downtown bars and eateries. Only complaint the lobby bar closes real early...

Reviews.Title: “Pretty but Problematic”
Reviews.Author: mkcgr
Reviews.Content: The rooms are well appointed and the bathroom is very large. However there is no tub and the shower head is so high that a short woman 5'3" can barely adjust the settings. Everything is charged extra and the food is limited and expensive. If you are on a restricted diet it is hard to eat here. Service was so-so. Breakfast was mixed up three times and finally after that we got a free breakfast. I was told over and over that it was a training problem. But the staff just doesn't work smoothly. I wanted to go to the pool and discovered that it was closed--a large sign said closed 3:00PM so we did not return and later found out that it reopened at 4:00 but the sign did not say closed between 3-4. Also some of the food outlets were closed limiting availability . Absolutely not for a family--what would the children eat and where would they bathe?

Reviews.Title: “managed and staffed by a circus act”
Reviews.Author: gringoca
Reviews.Content: This hotel gives Marriott a bad name. Try calling their front desk before you arrive... "Hello, Ritz Carlton" "Sorry, I dialed the wrong number" (dial again) "Hello, Ritz Carlton" (Hang up and try again) "Sorry, I'm trying to reach the Marriott and I think I have the wrong number" "No, we share the same line" Really?! Is the Marriott manager that ^*(#ing stupid? You can't afford your own phone line or operators?! It doesn't end there. During a 5 day stay ordered room service 7 times. 6 times the order was completely screwed up. 5 times the food was very late. No joke. Even after speaking with the manager, after the 2nd room service disaster, the problem was never fixed. And the food quality was poor, at even half the price we paid. The manager eventually offered us complimentary breakfast at the restaurant downstairs, but failed to mention (even after we told her we were in a hurry in the morning and the usless, late room service forced us to skip breakfast and be late for work) she failed to tell us that there's a 30-45 minute wait for a table at breakfast. If a hotel can not get even these elementary services right, it says a lot about the management. And none of what it says is good. These kind of shortcomings are unacceptable for a Marriott, especially a Marriott in the price range of this one. I'd give them negative-one star if it weren't for the nice decor, view, and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Even by hotel standards the food is overpriced and mediocre.”
Reviews.Author: Wart99
Reviews.Content: While I didn't stay overnight, I attended a luncheon during an international convention that was held at this hotel. The hotel charged $39.00 for the food which consisted of a few cubes of chicken mixed with a few pieces of iceberg lettuce followed by dessert, and that was it. When I asked for extra bread, because I was still hungry, my request was ignored. $39.00!!

Reviews.Title: “Best location for convention center and excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: Mimi9095
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the JW Marriott to attend the Anime Expo at the nearby convention center. The location was awesome for walking right out to Nokia Live, Staples Center, and the convention center...all within a five minute walk. Easy access from the freeway too. We were greeted right away as we pulled in and as soon as we entered the hotel their was someone to ask what we needed. Check in was fast and easy and "Alisha" walked us to the elevators and said she would be available the rest of that evening if we needed anything else. The room was very clean and exactly what I had asked for in my preferences. Because the Anime Expo was going on there was a large number of people in and out of the hotel all day but we never had to wait more than 30 seconds for an elevator to get to our room, plus the conference attendees just added to our entertainment with all their costumes. It got a little noisy the first night but the hotel must have had staff to monitor this because it got quiet real quick without having to call the front desk. "Rashad" was also very helpful when we needed something for our room. The pool is beautiful and well maintained. The hotel itself is very modern and clean. Wifi service is free in the main areas of the hotel but there is a charge if you use it in your room. The customer service in the hotel was impeccable and I will definitely choose this hotel again. I have two very minor complaints about the hotel. The maid service did not replace toiletries every day in the room as hotels usually do. It was okay though because we had brought our own stuff and I assume that the maid saw that and figured we did not need additional. The second complaint is the parking is expensive at $38.00 a day but that is probably the going rate for LA hotels. Other than that it was a great stay and a very reasonable room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, clean, ideal location for convention center”
Reviews.Author: Dreams_of_Travel
Reviews.Content: Nice new hotel, with staff eager to please, at the valet entrance and at the concierge. It is located where several media events tend to take place: LA Live. We witnessed, by happenstance a prime spot for the Tour d'California bike race and people entering Nokia Theater for the last live broadcast of American Idol of the season. The last two contestants strolled right past me as cameras followed them in. Prices for meals or food are over the top and not worth it. Go elsewhere. Concierge helped us with that. Our hotel room was very roomy--almost too much space between things. Not enough storage for a couple staying for 5 nights however. The bathroom was fabulous--very Japanese in styling, lots of room, but no tub just a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Still working out the kinks”
Reviews.Author: CocoFranco
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this hotel. I stayed here on business simply for the sake of convenience. Gripes: I travel often and asked for a complimentary upgrade upon arrival and the lady looked at me like I was stupid. There is always a line to check-in and check-out and for no good reason. My 7:30am wake up call came in at 8:00am. A mandatory $38.00 for parking. My 17th floor room was noisy but you're downtown so I suppose it's going to be noisy. Internet kept turning on and off and they still charged me to use it. Good things: Shiny new hotel, beautiful grounds and an excellent central location if you have to be downtown. Very well appointed rooms, clean lines, and decent design. The pool area is absolutely gorgeous. I don't think I will stay here again when I need to be downtown. They're still working out their kinks and I don't feel like waiting for them to figure it out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but the "newness" hasn't worn off yet...”
Reviews.Author: chazmassey
Reviews.Content: I'm a very loyal Marriott customer (Platinum Premier) and was eager to check out LA's newest Marriott hotel. Overall, not bad, but a little sterile, i.e., could use some art on the walls in the guestroom floors, better signage in the elevators as to what was on each floor, etc. I was upgraded to a corner king junior suite on the 21st floor (top of the JW side but the attached Ritz-Carlton starts on the higher floors and probably goes up at least 20 more). Stunning views of the freeways, downtown LA, and if the day was clear, you could probably have seen all the way to the Pacific. Executive lounge is on the 4th floor, adjacent to the pool area. Nice space, evening food selections so-so (cheese, crackers, crudité and two hot items) but enough to make dinner out of. Wine selection great - 3 choices for white and two for red (in most Marriott and even JW Marriott properties there are usually only two wine choices - red or white :-) and pricing is relatively reasonable ($9.00/glass for white, $12.00/glass for red). I went out in search of ice and at the elevator lobby on my floor saw a directional sign pointing to the "Ice & Vending" area (pic #1). Walked that direction and at the next turn saw a sign (pic #2) pointing towards guest rooms to the right and left, but couldn't find the ice machine to save my life. Went back to the elevator lobby and picked up the house phone which rang immediately to the "At Your Service" folks and was answered within two rings. Was told that the nearest ice machine was on the 18th floor (pic #3), so I ventured down three levels and by golly I found it (pic #4)! But why the sign on the 21st floor pointing to the non-existent ice machine??? I'll write that off to "newness" but I wonder if they have plans to install a vending area on floor 21 or if the sign is wrong (incidentally, you'll notice that pic #1 mentions room 2144, yet it isn't mentioned on pic #2 - that's because it doesn't exist - the highest room number on 21 is 2142 :-). Gym is nice - my judgment of a good hotel gym is if they have the large inflated exercise balls (they have three), and all of the standard equipment. Plenty of treadmills but only two bikes. Overall, I think this is a nice hotel, just needs a little time to be broken in, but it's one of the best hotels to open in downtown LA in years. I'll definitely be back (but I'll be passing along the comments and pics to the Marriott folks of course).

Reviews.Title: “Looks like an airport inside”
Reviews.Author: Spike357
Reviews.Content: I was expecting more from this hotel and was disappointed. Poor signage, and a total debacle at check in. My room was not ready when promised. Check is supposed to be at 4pm. At 5pm still no room. Fail. The inside looks like an airport or bus station as well. Very cold and impersonal

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, but not quite up to standards I expect from a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: consultantguydfw
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice now in the past two weeks, excited by a new hotel and a great corporate rate, but I think I'll stay at other downtown hotels instead. Check in was good. I was appropriately recognized as a Platinum Premier elite member of Marriott Rewards (maybe just as a Platinum on the first visit; I don't recall, and it really doesn't matter). The first stay I was directed to the various features of the hotel. On the second stay I was upgraded to the Vice Presidential Suite on the 15th floor. The room decor is nice (the standard room better than the suite). One thing I dislike about most hotel suites is that the bedroom is often much smaller than in a normal room. While the bedroom in this room was larger than in most suites, it was nevertheless smaller. TV actually has some channels in HD, but I was disappointed there was no My13 (I like to fall asleep watching Seinfeld at 10pm when I'm in LA). There is a media port on the side of the desk; although I did not use this, it would come in handy to stream video or watch DVDs from your laptop (assuming you bring appropriate cables). The air conditioning was inadequate in both rooms. While I love the nice thick duvet, I could not get the rooms cool enough to sleep comfortably. Also, I think the beds are a bit firmer than the Marriott beds in other properties, but perhaps they're just newer. The shower at first seemed nice, but the water pressure is woefully inadequate. I think I still have soap in my belly button. I'm sure the hotel would blame the A/C and shower issues on being "green" - I hope business that take "green" to this extent win enough additional business to offset my loss of business. The check-in agent on my first visit did point out that I had free internet access as a Platinum Elite member (per Marriott's new policy in response to Starwood's new benefit), but I did not use the service on either of my stays. Although the Concierge Lounge was great the first stay, it was closed the second stay; they said it was closed for renovation, but that's perplexing since this is a new hotel. The morning Concierge Lounge attendant was absolutely wonderful. In the Concierge Lounge Hot items varied each day and the fruit selection was quite nice. Having San Pellegrino in the lounge is also a plus in my books. A couple of hot appetizers, hard Italian cheeses, and deserts are offered in the lounge in the evenings. On the second stay, I was offered a free breakfast buffet each day as a Platinum Marriott Rewards member. Service was more leisure than accommodating; it would have been better had daily coupons been offered that could have just been left at the table instead of having each person wait on the check. Also, no Concierge Lounge on the second stay meant no extra water or soft beverages than what came in the room. I really like the gym, but depending on what else is going on at the hotel, it can be VERY crowded in the mornings. The machines are all new and modern, and they include HD TVs (although the HD signal is poor on many of the machines and often pixelate so much that the local channels are unwatchable). Like the rooms, the gym is also very warm. Too bad the machines don't have the little built-in fans like at the Marriott Downtown. One thing I really hate about this hotel is that they do not put hotel receipts under the door. You have to go down and get the receipts from the front desk - a complete waste of time for the business traveler. Too bad Marriott doesn't post receipts online like Hilton. And while I also get receipts emailed to me, I find this to sometimes be unreliable (and one college doesn't ever get them even though he is signed up for this service). I did not use room service, but other colleagues found the service extremely slow and inaccurate. However, if you complain about issues, the hotel does seem to throw free stuff your way (free beer and bottled water with room service, bonus Marriott Rewards points for other problems). There just seems to be a lot of employees standing around at this hotel but no one really doing anything. We experienced this at the hotel restaurant for breakfast needing drinks and bills without our waitress in sight, but plenty of others were standing around doing nothing. Same for the valet pickup. And speaking of valet parking, you have to go down to the bowels of the garage to get your car and snake out of the maze that is the LA Live garage. The location and the logistics are really a hassle. I may stay here occasionally, but it's just too much of a hassle to stay here regularly. And, I will definitely make sure the Concierge Lounge is open before returning again.

Reviews.Title: “"This really is a Beautiful Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: Lindyloo1
Reviews.Content: After I had booked this hotel for a night for my husband and I we read some reviews posted on Trip Advisor that were and were not so good. Take it from us its a splendid hotel. It may be more modern than the usual JW Marriott but it has not lost its service, comfort, beautiful furnishings etc etc. Somebody mentioned they didn't have tubs - they don't, so if you have a particular hang up about this then don't go to this hotel. The showers are lovely and quite honestly who needs a tub anyway ! Check in superb, room was to die for furnishings and everything was quality. Cannot say enough about it we loved it. The Ritz Carlton is the other side of the JW as both hotels own the same building - Ritz Carlton of course being Marriotts up market hotel. Outside there is the LA Live screens all showing different things. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Trendy, JW Marriott L.A. Live! What all LA hotels should want to be!”
Reviews.Author: suzyav8trix
Reviews.Content: It's new. It's lovely. It's not perfect. But it is wonderful! Hubby and I stayed here for 2 nights the weekend before Memorial Day. The Lakers were in the play-offs, but not at home, so the hotel was busy, but not completely full. After spending a week in another (awful) hotel just a few miles away for business, this was a welcome treat! Friday afternoon LA traffic was horrible -- not surprisingly. We pulled up to the hotel and the valet were quick to whisk the car away. We knew it was going to be $38 a night for parking there (with in and out privilege -- and be sure to ask for the valet extension and call ahead, so you don't have to wait for your car when you do want to leave). If I had not gotten a bargain on the rental car (full-size, less than $20 per day with taxes and fees), we may have opted for using taxis. In the end, we were happy to have the convenience of a car so that we could come and go as we pleased. The lobby is huge. Or, the ceiling is so high, it definitely SEEMS huge! I've noticed other reviewers weren't "sure" where check-in was, but when you walk in, there's 3 or 4 "counters" or check-in desks straight in front of you -- what else would they be? There are also a number of folks in "uniform" -- well, tan Marriott-issued suits with hot pink ties that match the decor (especially some of the lighting -- above and to the right) to guide you. It was mere seconds before someone offered to help us with our luggage and to check us in. I, personally, like the open feeling and not being "smushed" up against a wall to check in. One of the first things you'll notice is that the hotel is not your typical Marriott. The decor is a cross between Euro/60s modern/70s colors/80s flair/Japanese Zen -- and somehow, it works. (see pictures) It seems modern and retro, lively and serene, all at the same time. Being platinum with Marriott Rewards we got upgraded to a corner, executive King room on the 13th floor (26 floors, I think) and free internet. The room was huge with picture windows on two sides to the east and to the south overlooking Nokia theatre and Staples Center, as well as the LA Live! district. The daytime views were spectacular -- including Catalina Island in the distance. The nighttime views with the search-lights and neon was almost as pretty. Even the bathroom had a huge "picture" window overlooking Staples Center and the LA convention center, as well as the 4th floor rooftop pool, below. Again, the decor was eclectic -- and while not my preference in color choice (orange?) -- it somehow works. The windows had sheers, as well as room-darking drapes that worked; the bathroom had a room darkening roman shade for nighttime, too. The room was VERY quiet and quite large. The only "noise" I heard was 2 neighbors' doors slamming at 2:30 in the morning on the 2nd night. I probably heard them because everything else was so quiet. And they're are the kind of self-closing doors that slam shut if you let them. And people are lazy -- especially at 2:30 in the morning. The bathroom was huge. No, there was no bathtub -- but seriously, I have not taken a bath in well over 10 years and never missed it. I loved the walk-in shower (big enough for two, but could use a shower head at both ends to make that work) -- and with it not being a bathtub, it's much easier and safer to get in and out of... The water pressure does seem low -- but I believe that's a result of the "low flow" faucets in all of the new or redone hotels in the area. I rather enjoyed it as it was very relaxing and it took maybe 10 seconds longer to rinse my hair (and I'm a woman). The toiletries were very nice and the sink area is huge with a nice shelf below to store things, too. We asked for extra pillows -- I have a bad knee and like to elevate it -- and they were delivered in less than 10 minutes. On the second night, one of the managers I had been engaging in conversation sent us dessert to our room. This was a surprise, and we were more surprised when we got a phone call stating that room service was outside our door with a delivery and we had a "do not disturb" sign out... Hmm. Last I checked "Do Not Disturb" meant we didn't want to be disturbed... Hubby got up and obligingly let them in -- they did come bearing chocolate-covered strawberries, after all... However, if it had been 20 or 30 minutes earlier -- I would have been VERY upset as it would have been a very unwelcome interruption. I probably should have mentioned this at check-out, but forgot. The concierge lounge was closed for the weekend -- this is nothing new. Most close at noon on Friday and re-open at noon on Sunday. However, it's hit or miss as to whether you can get still get breakfast coupons -- we did not, here. We had drinks and appetizers (or "small plates") in the "Glance" bar. The service was excellent and so was the food. We both had 2 glasses of wine. The prices were no higher than the other hotel I was at in the same area, earlier in the week, where the service was non-existent and the food was horrible. Saturday, it was quite busy in the hotel lobby as there was a professional bicycle race passing through town and stopping at LA Live for the day. We went to the Farm of Beverly Hills for brunch at L.A. Live! -- excellent food and Bloody Mary's were on special -- even better! Even though hubby and I used to live in Long Beach, we spent the day playing "tourist". Everything we wanted to do and see was within 20-30 mins of the hotel. We went to Griffith Park and the Observatory, drove as close as we could get to the Hollywood sign, and then spent time in Hollywood on the Blvd and Sunset. We had had a busy day and decided to have dinner at the Hotel; although the L.A. Live! complex has choices such as the Yard House, Conga Line, Flemings, and more. Dinner was VERY good -- I had meatloaf that was superb and hubby had a lobster linguine dish that looked divine (I'm allergic). Service was good and prices were not too far out of line and the food quality was excellent. It was so good we decided to have breakfast there the next morning. It was too late for the buffet, so we ordered off the breakfast/lunch menu. Service was 180 degrees from the evening before -- taking forever just to get water or our drinks brought to the table. The food was good, but if we were on any kind of time schedule, we would have had to leave before getting our food. Breakfast, even lunch, usually doesn't take over an hour. This did. Because of the delay, I asked for a late check-out time and was granted 2:30. I think we could've even stayed longer if we had needed. We went to the pool and jacuzzi. It was windy -- and too cool for swimming in the pool -- but the jacuzzi was very nice. Big. Clean. Deep. Nice jets with interesting movements. After that, we walked to the movie theaters and took in a matinée before leaving for the airport. My one area of complaint would be the concierge staff. I needed to print something and as I noted, the "concierge" lounge is closed on weekends. As a Marriott platinum elite, I'm used to being able to print anything at any time -- for free. I called and asked about the business center and was told it, too, was closed, with a "but". I was told that there were computers and printers outside the business center available 24/7. Cool. Not. These computers/printers required a credit card to use! The concierge on the phone had not mentioned this. So I went to the concierge desk and he offered to let me use his computer and printer as I had to access a password protected website. Nice gesture, but he should have been more attentive to what I was asking for in the first place -- I told him on the phone I was platinum and was used to NOT paying to print anything! Maybe he was having a bad day -- but he certainly did nothing to make mine any better! That was Saturday. On Sunday, when it was time to leave, I asked the young lady working the concierge desk if she could call and have the valet ready our car and handed her the claim check. She tells me I need to go "downstairs" -- when you needed your car you went down into the parking garage to pick it up from the valet. I said, "Great! Can you please tell me the extension to call to have them ready my car and where a house phone is that I can call them from!" She looked at me like I was from another planet. My hubby was approaching, then, with our luggage. She just stared at him. I said to him, "All I asked is for her to call the valet to get our car ready and I guess they don't do that here." Just then she says, "Oh -- I can do that!" In a very snotty tone of voice. If we weren't leaving, I would have brought that up to management -- but we needed to get on the road. (Very odd that both my experiences with the concierge desk personnel were bad. Everything else had gone so nice at the hotel. I get the impression that neither were very experienced in their positions.) All in all, I would return to the JW Marriott L.A. Live! We had a "new opening" rate of $209 a night and the location could not be beat for what we wanted to do. Would love to return and take in a show at the Nokia -- it's supposed to be quite nice. I like the upscale, yet unpretentious feel of the hotel and the staff was mostly very attentive and accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “High-End just enough was right business hotel”
Reviews.Author: LineeNYC
Reviews.Content: Hotel was worth the $199/day conference rate - best location & proximety to convention center. I wouldn't want to pay more than that though. The common areas were well designed. The room featured a nice bed and noteworthy bathroom - adjustable lighting (dimmers), nice shower. Plenty of closet and drawer space. On the downside - No morning newspapers and Hotel lacks full offering of TV channels but there are just enough. Room service was just ok but food was not that good. Being from NYC, I would not consider the restaurant / room service to be too pricey but then again it is not as good as it should be - Their offering is just standard and the coffee is disappointing. Almost everytime the order was incorrect and I had to call for missing items. For those who require better than decent coffee - There is an ILLy coffee bar in lobby (beautiful but service takes a long time) and also a Starbucks across the street but within the LA Live complex.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive: And Worth It”
Reviews.Author: JLDCA
Reviews.Content: One of the best executive lounges at any hotel I have stayed at. The food is similar to what you will find in other Marriott, Hilton and Hyatt Hotels but the service at this hotel is a step above. In the executive lounge I asked if there was a Wall Street Journal, there was not so I read the USA Today---ten min. later a guy walks in with the WSJ and would not let me tip him. The morning breakfast in the lounge is excellent, so is the front desk crew. The downstairs lobby is loud. The rooms have excellent internet. Parking is $38/day but $25/day next to the hotel without in and out service. Healthclub was very crowded at 6:30A.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel (if you must stay downtown)”
Reviews.Author: pencil212
Reviews.Content: Currently staying on the 21st floor of this brand new hotel. I have to admit I was not looking forward to staying here. We had to stay downtown because of a convention and I know that downtown LA is pretty bleak. However, this hotel is really a bright oasis despite its not fantastic location in terms of things to walk to easily. The furnishings are are bright and elegant. I am sitting in an aqua butterfly chair next to a golden rod, retro-mod loveseat. We have a nice view of the mountains but I think the rooms on the freeway side of the building actually offer the best view.Rooms are almost silent from noise and the hotel feels very booked. The JW toiletries are great and the bathroom is large although no tub in our room. Coffeemaker and small fridge without minibar clutter make this a great room. The thing that really impressed me so far is the staff. The check in team was wonderful. Bright smiles. Very eager to make our stay terrific. Here is how I know this is a great hotel. The real sign of a fantastic hotel is shown when things go wrong. Yesterday the valet smashed the rear end of our rental car. We got a call from Rick the manager and he told us what happened and he did absolutely everything to make sure this did not disrupt our trip in any way. He swaped out the car with our rental company and gave us the use of the garage's car service. We were the first accident the garage has had since it opened so they were very apologetic and quick to make things right. Truthfully, it did mess up our day somewhat but everyone's attitude was so accomodating that we were able to get past it. My only criticism is the fee for Internet at $12.95 a day per computer. I wish these chains would wake up to the fact that free internet is essential for all travelers. I don't want to be charged for something that is not a luxury! Overall, very pleased with the experience here and if you must stay downtown this is the absolute best option.

Reviews.Title: “The Un-Marriott”
Reviews.Author: MisstheDogs
Reviews.Content: The JW at LA Live is more like a "W" hotel than your standard Marriott, which may be a good or bad thing, depending on your perspective. It's clearly trying to be hip and trendy and, for the most part, it succeeds. On the outside: the hotel is right next door/on top of LA Live, including the Staples Center, Nokia Theater, etc. Thus, it's walking distance to many restaurants. It is not close to othe LA attractions. Hotel parking is very expensive at $38/day; there is parking at LA Live for $25. Consider whether you need to park a car as there is a Hertz desk inside the hotel. On the inside -- public areas: It's all very modern. As others have said, none of the desks (registration, concierge) are marked but there are plenty of people to direct you. There was never a long wait. There is a lobby bar but, the one time I tried it, it was impossible to find a seat. The tables and chairs are grouped such that, if one person sits down alone, it means that about 5 seats are out of service unless you want to be up close and personal with a total stranger. And, in one of the bars 1/2 of the tables were "reserved," although no one was sitting at them. I gave up and went to my room. The rooms: I had a high floor room with a wonderful view. Decor is quite modern ("sofa" looked nice but wasn't very functional) and not at all reminiscent of most Marriotts at which I've stayed -- lots of black and earth tones and light wood. Bed was fine, TV was a large flat screen, robe was a nice touch. I don't believe there was a mini-bar but I never actually checked. The bathroom has a huge shower only, no tub. I found the "rainfall" shower annoying as it was hard to get shampoo out of your hair w/o spending about 5 mins to do it -- not much water pressure. The room was very quiet -- not sure if that holds true for low floor rooms. Towels were plush but that could be because they, like the hotel, are new. Miscellaneous notes: Elevators were quite prompt for such a large hotel. Internet service is $12.95 for 24 hrs. Restaurant choices are somewhat limited for such a large hotel but, as noted, you're steps away from many great choices. When there is a large convention in the hotel, it gets noisy and crowded in the public areas and you start to feel like a number despite the best efforts of the staff to make things personable. Summary: The JW is expensive; you're really paying for location. If you don't need to be in the heart of LA Live, you can probably do as well at other hotels in terms of what you get for the money. If you need to be here for business or pleasure, the Marriott delivers a good product, albeit at a price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Staples centre and LA Live Community”
Reviews.Author: erwk05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at JW Marriott in April, just 2 months after opening. I was concerned as whether any issues would be ironed out by this time, as I have read other reviews on new places with problems. All of the Staff were excellent here and the hotel was great. We arrived at 7am and were given two rooms sort of through a fire exit type door near to the pool area. the pool area seemed fairly quiet, no big parties etc. happening up there. The location was excellent as we were attending 2 NBA games and an NHL game at Staples Centre during our stay. The lights around the LA Live complex were very pretty and the restaurants were great (in Particular Flemings steak house) The Hotel is a little out of the way from Hollywood but we found cabs quite easy to get around. The only gripe we had was the 5th floor windows had some overactive loud seagulls who loved talking to and attacking their reflections banging on the windows from about 6am. I would stay at this hotel again if I were to stay in LA but probably on a higher floor to avoid those seagulls. I enjoyed the LA Live Complex which added extra points for JW Marriott’s review

Reviews.Title: “It is not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: cynicaltouchstone
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible experience when I checked in. The front desk was crowded and seemed disorganized. When my turn came after waiting for a while, a woman at the desk told me "I'll be back". But a white fat man just cut in and told her to take care of him. I was surprised that she handled his request right away very politely in front of me. It was sooo humiliaiting and unfair. After he left, I comlained to her and she apologised but her excuse did not make sense at all. It was definitely discrimination against a colored person. Other staff were very nice and the room was clean but I will never forget this experience. Besides, the "delux room" had no bath tub. I have to say "it is not worth your money".

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but not quite finished....”
Reviews.Author: UStravellerChicago
Reviews.Content: On arrival at the JW Marriott, you are swooped on by valet parking, who are very courteous and helpful. We already knew parking was $38 - way out of line but there was no obvious alternative, and with several suitcases and children, being on site is convenient - still too expensive though. The hotel is beautiful, clean and contemporary. Still smells brand new. The front desk were fine and friendly. Dinner in the hotel was lovely - fresh food, but it was a full restaurant the night we were there and it took us 45 mins to get our meal, no apologies. Our meal cost around $130, including a couple of largers. We ask about conceirge lounge, it isnt finished yet we are told. We ask about vouchers for breakfast - something Marriotts will offer if the lounge is closed, they say after consultation that we can have free breakfast. We then get a call telling us they will give us free breakfast, great. We have breakfast , have to ask twice for coffee. We tell the staff about the voucher situ and they say thats fine and we get $20 each so covers the buffet) we get a bill, we write on the bill that we are members. We are planning to extend our stay as one of the children is ill. We book the room again, go to see front desk, they have a bill so far including breakfast charge $67. After a bit of discussion they say they will take the charge off but that we were only entitled to the adults getting complimentary breakfast($42), which is fine but someone has to tell us surely??We eat breakfast one more day (we each only have cereal and toast (milk a day out of date and coffee once again doesnt arrive till we have finished eating, the waitress only charges cereal and one continental about $23), and then the rest of the time we go to starbucks - just less hassle eventhough it costs us. The room was great, spacious and fresh, decor different, we liked it but think it will date very quickly. Bathroom a good space - lovely and clean, lots of towels.Toilet a bit annoying, got blocked a few times. The sliding door on the bathroom didnt give a lot of privacy - ok for us but maybe not so good if you were with a friend. Our room was high and we could hear the noise from the Staples didnt bother us but might be worse lower down. Location good for the Staples and Noikia centers, and not bad for travelling around from - near a few main freeways etc. We didn't walk about in the evenings though as didnt feel that safe out of the immediate vacinity. Advertised as pool, spa coffee bar etc, none of these are yet finished / open, the children were disappointed about the pool area being closed - it was too cold anyway but they still like to go in the tub. The coffee shop wasnt open, and there was no shop. Fitness center well equipped - great. We stayed for a variety of rates from $174 to $239 plus of course the $38 per day parking, really makes it expensive, and will be more so I imagine once all finished. On the whole a great new hotel, we liked the style and newness, staff generally ok, but seemed to be a hassle to get anything done.

Reviews.Title: “Right in LA downtown, hi end, good for the fans”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: The JW and the Ritz are new additions downturn and they sure are high end. Very nice fittings. Bathrooms are nicely done without being opulent, interestingly the bed was a bit saggy. its a stroll to Staples and the convention center. The place is capcious in scale and you can walk for miles with 100 foot ceilings - its needs to get some character. The room rate at $169 will not last long but they make up for it by fairly expensive food. although breakfast was great. Parking is $25.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a rejuvenated area of downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: phiflyers
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night in a room on the 11th floor and was very pleased with my overall experience. Right when I arrived at the hotel I was greeted by the very friendly staff. The check-in process was a breeze and I had my room key in no time. The room was very pleasant to walk into and I was surprised by how spacious it was. There was a good sized flat screen TV, refrigerator, and iron in the room. The bed was very comfortable and made it easy to fall asleep. The a/c unit was perfect in terms of noise as it was very quiet and definitely won’t keep a light sleeper up. The bathroom had plenty of space and could easily accommodate multiple people if necessary. I didn’t buy the internet package because it was fairly pricy per day. I found it interesting that they were still able to get away with charging for internet usage as just about every other hotel that I have gone to recently gives you internet access for free. I also tried out the breakfast in the lobby area and was pleased with everything they had to offer. You will not go hungry after eating breakfast at this hotel. Overall, I was very pleased with my stay at the JW Marriott LA Live, but was ultimately disappointed that they don’t offer free internet service.

Reviews.Title: “We were fans”
Reviews.Author: S-Dubb
Reviews.Content: I am pretty fussy when it comes to hotels. My husband and I planned a weekend trip to Cali to get out of Chicago. The purpose was to do tourist stuff - Lakers game, Leno, hiking in the Hollywood Hills, Walk of Fame. This hotel was great for everything. Granted, LA traffic is horrible and it is challenging getting around. But I couldn't complain - this place was never more than 20 minutes away from where we wanted to go. The lobby is EXCEPTIONAL. We had a few drinks there one night - great vibe. The staff was all wonderful too. The rooms were nice, but my husband and I didn't love the decor (we are both 28 years old, and the curtains and other yellow/orange theme reminded us too much of our parents outdated 1970's living rooms). But the bathroom was great - HUGE and had a large shower and a big countertop for all my hair and makeup stuff. We went to a Lakers Game (couldn't have been a better location). We had actually planned to switch to the Hollywood Marriott Renaissance for our last night because of the great reviews, but ended up cancelling so we could stay here another night and instead go to the LA Kings game. I am definitely a hotel snob. I liked this a lot, but didn't fall in love. If it had a bathroom and a little larger room, I may have fallen in love. But I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and Comfy”
Reviews.Author: lisarose
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with the University of Washington basketball team during the Pac-10 tournament, so I didn't have to pay for the room (about $350), or the internet ($13/day), or meals (not sure of the price but I believe around $40/person). I would never stay here on my own budget, but it's great if you're on the company's dime. The hotel is stylish, plush, and brand new, with great service and beautiful business facilities. However, I think the price of the food, internet, and business facilities was pretty ridiculous. Location is great if you are here for a sporting event at the Staples Center or meetings downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girls Night Out”
Reviews.Author: beansy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night for a girls night out...the rooms are very clean and modern. The lobby and bar are large and have a good vibe. We were able to walk around and visited the Yard House for lunch and then the Conga Room at night. It was nice to be able to walk and feel safe in the downtown area. The pool and jacuzzi area also looks nice (but, it was too cold outside for us to try).

Reviews.Title: “Good for a Downtown Location”
Reviews.Author: longboard
Reviews.Content: Located in the LA Live so it is walking distance to Staples, Nokia and Convetsion Center. 5 minute drive to USC. The hotel was nice but basic. Rooms were average size, modern decor, big TV and good electronic plugs, shower with no tub and single sink, very comfy bed. Hotel had a nice lobby with a large ultra lounge bar. Just opened so service was very good. Parking was $38 ouch. Its connected to the Rirz Carlton but the Ritz did not seem to be open when we were there. Good place to stay if you have a reason to stay downtown, would not really recommend downtown if you don't have a reason to be there, its not too exciting. It would be a real good place for the USC visiitors, short easy drive down Figueroa. The crowd at LA Live tends to go with whatever the activities are currently playing. During hockey/ basketball season there is something about everday. Good selection of restaurants just outside the hotel, we went to Yardhouse, Starbucks and Trader Vics, also close the the famous Pantry for breakfast.

HotelInfo.Name: JW Marriott Hotel Los Angeles at L.A. LIVE
HotelInfo.Address: 900 West Olympic Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90015
